image.caption: Complete dribble ... Lionel Messi is at centre of a football fantasy

video.caption: SYRIA'S state TV has accused Barca star of sending secret signals

articles.articlebody:
SOCCER superstar Lionel Messi was last night dragged into the weirdest propaganda war ever between opposing sides in Syria.

The world's highest- paid footballer was accused of sending secret signals to gun-smuggling rebels  using his DRIBBLING skills.

The outrageous claims about the Barcelona star are made in a video posted online. A voiceover says that on Sunday, Syrian TV channel Addounia broadcast footage of Messi, 24, going on a twisting run before setting up a goal for Pedro against Real Madrid.

It then claims his darting runs were a secret code used by gun runners  and by tracking the direction of the dribbles, passes and shot, it is possible to draw a route into Syria.

As Messi makes his run, the voiceover states: "Here we see the first stage where arms are loaded from Lebanon. Then they pass through Homs and are delivered to another terrorist. We also see how they warn that they will face some obstacles until they reach Dayr Al Zawr."

As Pedro's shot hits the net, the voice says: "Then they are transported by bus to the final destination, located in Al Magadin."

But the jury was out as to whether the Argentinian ace had been unwittingly used in a piece of government brainwashing, rebel propaganda or just a daft hoax.

It would not be the first time state-controlled Addounia made crazy claims. The channel once said a rival station sent coded messages via its weather forecasts.

But Syria experts said the film could also be a bid to smear Syrian tyrant President Bashar al-Assad.

Prof Mark Almond of Oxford University said: "If I were a Syrian rebel, or someone sympathetic to them, I might make such a video to show the world how silly the Assad regime is."

l.heighton@the sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: WATCH VIDEO: SOCCER ace accused of sending signals  using his DRIBBLING skills
articles.headline: Riddle of Messi's 'secret signals'
articles.subdeck: Complete dribble ... Lionel Messi is at centre of a football fantasy

image.caption: Dump the pump tax ... plea

article.caption: Osborne's £20billion to save small firms
Let's get Britain grafting
Fuel plea to Cameron
PM: I was tucked in bed by Obama

articles.articlebody:
STRUGGLING Brits have issued a final desperate plea to George Osborne ahead of his Budget today  to tame soaring petrol prices with a fuel duty cut.

As the Chancellor gets ready to reveal his plan for Britain's finances, an exclusive YouGov poll for The Sun shows more than three quarters of the country  77 per cent  want to see him slash the crippling levy.

And a third said that would be the most desirable tax cut he could produce from his red box.

In addition, three out of five people  58 per cent  hold the Government personally responsible for high petrol prices, rather than oil firms or world markets.

And for the first time, a majority also revealed the sky-high tax is seriously affecting the pattern of their daily lives.

Fifty-one per cent say soaring prices mean they are having to cut back spending elsewhere or avoid driving their car. A quarter say they are on the roads "much less".

The findings give massive support to The Sun's Keep It Down campaign to win a better deal for hard-pressed motorists.

Britain already charges the highest tax on fuel in the European Union, with 60p going straight to the taxman in fuel duty and VAT for every £1 handed over at the pumps. It is 58p for diesel.

Worse is already to come with a 3p hike in fuel duty  ordered by the last Labour government  coming in August.

That rise alone will mean the monthly petrol bill for a two-car family will go up by £7.69.

Meanwhile oil prices  currently US$124 per barrel  are likely to rise, with instability in the Middle East set to deepen as troubles over Iran and Syria worsen.

And a plan by PM David Cameron and US President Barack Obama to lower them was dealt a blow yesterday.

The leaders, who met in Washington DC last week, agreed to look at releasing more reserve stocks on to the market. But France and Germany opposed the move, saying it was not yet enough of an emergency.

Having cut fuel duty and frozen rises in his two previous Budgets, the Chancellor appeared to rule out any further action on the issue today.

But there were new record prices at the pumps yesterday with unleaded averaging 139p per litre and diesel 146p.

On Budget Day in 2007, petrol cost just 90p a litre and diesel 93p.

AA president Edmund King said: "At the very minimum the Chancellor must freeze fuel duty. If it goes up, it will affect the economy. It's already meaning people are losing their jobs, reducing their spend, and hindering the economic recovery.

"Ironically he would make more money if he decided to freeze or reduce the duty as the economy would benefit."

Road Haulage Association chief Geoff Dunning said another hike in duty would be "reckless".

In a special report, economists last week revealed that a cut in fuel duty of 2.5p per litre would create 175,000 jobs and boost growth.



Spending axe will fund lower

taxes



GEORGE Osborne will today cut overall tax paid by Brits  by ordering more spending cuts.

The Chancellor will take a fresh axe to some ministries' already parlous finances so he can reduce the nation's tax bill by several billions.

The unexpected move means he will today unveil the first tax-cutting Budget since before the financial crash  delighting Tories.

But the controversial extra cuts on top of the existing £81billion reduction will spark renewed outrage with Labour and the unions.

Amid a host of major personal tax changes being made today, the lowest earners will be the big winners and the rich will face a painful new soaking.

The number of poorly-paid workers who pay no income tax will rise to two million thanks to a £1,000 hike in the tax-free earnings threshold to just above £9,100. That will mean tax relief of £200 for low and middle earners in April 2013, on top of the £205 break next month  saving them around £400 a year, as The Sun revealed on Monday.

There will also be "substantial" new tax rises for the rich, a Coalition source said last night.

A new seven per cent top rate of stamp duty will be enforced on houses costing £2million or more.

The wealthy will see just one cut, with the 50p income tax rate for those on above £150,000 a year brought down to 45p next year. To back this controversial move, Mr Osborne will publish a study by Revenue officials.

It is expected to reveal returns on the 50p top rate have fallen well short of the £2.7billion forecast when it was introduced by his Labour predecessor Alistair Darling.

Radical action is also expected to simplify the appallingly complicated tax collection system.

Mr Osborne will also reaffirm his commitment to the Government's deficit reduction plan, meaning another five more years of austerity.

In a head-on drive to find growth, the Chancellor will also unveil a massively slimmed-down planning blueprint to speed up new building projects. That will be welcomed by the construction industry but bitterly attacked by countryside campaigners.



UK is on the grow



THE UK economy may do slightly better this year than had been thought, the Treasury's official forecaster is expected to say today.

The Office for Budget Responsibility is likely to revise 2012's growth estimate upwards from 0.7 per cent to 0.8 per cent.

The positive news is a sign the green shoots of recovery may be arriving after four years of economic gloom.

Figures yesterday showed inflation fell to 3.4 per cent last month, a .3 per cent drop.

Economists are projecting consumer spending will grow after higher than expected retail spending at the end of 2011.



Drink up already...



THE price of whisky, vodka and other spirits soared last month AHEAD of today's Budget.

Official inflation figures yesterday showed they leapt 2.6 per cent in February  the biggest ever increase for the month.

Experts blamed price "resetting" after New Year discounts  but also the higher cost of grain and transport.

The Chancellor is expected to add to the pain today by waiving through another duty hike on booze  with pints rising by as much as 10p.

Overall, inflation fell to a 15-month low. The Office of National Statistics put it down to lower gas and electricity bills.



myView



by Tom Newton Dunn, Political Editor



PREPARE to hear a lot today about changes to personal rates of tax.

The moment George Osborne sits back down, the spin war will begin.

Not with Labour but from inside the Coalition.

Nick Clegg's team have already been at it quietly for months. Now both parties will champion their own pet causes.

But try to concentrate on one thing: all the tax manoeuvres in the world will mean nothing unless they get growth back into our pathetic economy.

If they don't, it's just a frantic rearrangement of deckchairs on the Titanic.

t.newtondunn@the-sun.co.uk
articles.byline: By TOM NEWTON DUNN, Political Editor, and STEVE HAWKES
articles.teaser: FINAL desperate call to the Chancellor ahead of Budget  to tame soaring petrol prices
articles.headline: Don't be a fool ... cut fuel
articles.subdeck: Dump the pump tax ... plea

article.caption: Fabrice Muamba asks: Did we lose?
Muamba Twitter troll faces jail
Muamba speaks
Prem star Fabrice is still critical

video.caption: CARDIOLOGIST Dr Andrew Deaner tells of his role in helping Bolton star
BOLTON boss has spoken to star and club say he has had a "comfortable" night
MAN City boss believes football medical regulations needs improving

image.caption: Hope ... Fabrice Muamba
Muamba 'dead' for 78 mins - doc reveals how long it took to get ace's heart started

articles.articlebody:
STRICKEN star Fabrice Muamba was "in effect dead" for 78 MINUTES after he collapsed on the field from a cardiac arrest, his club doctor said today.

Bolton Wanderers medic Jonathan Tobin revealed it took 15 SHOCKS to get the 23-year-old's heart started after he collapsed on the pitch on Saturday.

He also told how docs worked on Muamba for 48 MINUTES between his collapse and arrival at the hospital.

And Dr Tobin described how it took another 30 MINUTES before his heart started beating again.

He said: "In effect, he was dead in that time."

The news came as it was revealed Bolton WILL take on Blackburn at home on Saturday.

Muamba remains in intensive care at the London Chest Hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest during his side's FA Cup clash with Spurs.

Dr Tobin, who visited the player yesterday evening, said: "I'm glad to say that the early signs of recovery have continued. I went to see Fabrice last night. I went in and he said 'Hi, doc'.

"I asked him how he was and he said 'Fine'."

Dr Tobin said the player had asked him what had happened.

He said: "I explained to him what had happened. That's the sort of level of communication I have had with Fabrice."

Speaking at the hospital in Bethnal Green, East London, he told of his reaction when he first realised the player was in trouble.

He said all that was going through his head was "Oh my God, it's Fabrice".

Dr Tobin admitted he broke down in tears in the hospital corridor when the seriousness of what had happened to the player hit home  and added that he had feared the worst.

JOIN OUR CAMPAIGN FOR CPR IN SCHOOLS BY CLICKING HERE

Dr Andrew Deaner, the cardiologist and Tottenham fan who leapt from his seat in the crowd and rushed on to the pitch to help the player, said his recovery could be described as "miraculous".

He said: "If you're going to use the term miraculous, I guess it could be used here."

Dr Deaner went to visit the player after he had woken up and said that Muamba was able to make a joke even that early on into his recovery process.

He said: "I whispered into his ear 'What's your name?'"

The footballer gave his name.

Dr Deaner went on: "I said 'I understand you're a very good footballer'. And he said 'I try'."

Yesterday pals said Fabrice asked why Bolton's FA Cup tie at Spurs had been abandoned  and was told by his dad: "Because of you."

Pals of the Wanderers midfield ace said he had no idea where he was when he came to in a hospital bed.

His father Marcel asked him if he knew who he was. Family friend Aime Esalo revealed: "Fabrice said 'Yes' and the next thing he asked was, 'Did we lose?'

"He was told the match was called off while the two teams were drawing 1-1. Fabrice asked why they had stopped it and his father said, 'Because of you'."

Mr Esalo told how Muamba, who continued to make encouraging progress yesterday, also asked for his fiancée Shauna Muganda when he regained consciousness on Monday.

But the couple's son Joshua, three, was not there.

Muamba, was saved from death by CPR  cardiopulmonary resuscitation, pumping the chest to create artificial blood circulation  given on the pitch during the televised quarter-final tie.

And today The Sun is launching a campaign calling for such life-saving skills to become part of the national curriculum in schools, so kids learn how to help in an emergency.

They should also know sudden cardiac arrests are DIFFERENT from heart attacks.

The former can occur in the young and healthy if the heart goes into a dangerous rhythm.

Heart attacks are caused by blocked arteries often linked to old age or unhealthy lifestyles.

Doctors said he had been "very fortunate" to pull through as fewer than one in five cardiac arrest victims survive and most suffer brain damage.

And Spurs striker Emmanuel Adebayor last night painted a positive picture after visiting Muamba  a former team-mate when both played for Arsenal.

Adebayor, who was joined by Chelsea's Michael Essien on a previous visit, said the player was on "on good form" and "back with us again". He added: "He's much better, he's talking, he's acting normal. As a brother, as a friend, it is a big relief."

Bolton boss Owen Coyle said he "managed to exchange a few words" with Muamba during a visit. He added: "Fabrice remains critical but there has been improvement. It's still very early and he has a long way to go."

Asked if Muamba could make a full recovery, Coyle replied: "It has happened before."

The manager was joined at the hospital by Bolton skipper Kevin Davies and several club players.

The team will resume training today and are set to return to Tottenham on Tuesday to replay the Cup tie as long as Muamba continues to recover.

Coyle and Shauna, 27, both thanked legions of well-wishers for their "incredible" support.

Shauna tweeted: "Fabrice has felt every single one of your prayers."

Referee Howard Webb, in charge of the Cup game, praised the 35,000-strong crowd for "almost pushing with the doctor and willing him to get Fabrice's heart going". Football stars Jack Wilshere, Phil Jones and Bacary Sagna tweeted goodwill messages to Muamba yesterday.

Sunderland players wore "Pray for Muamba" T-shirts before last night's Premier League game at Blackburn, as did ref Martin Atkinson. Rovers' Yakubu showed off a similar vest when he scored. And in Spain, Barcelona's Lionel Messi showed support with a T-shirt before playing Granada last night.

But amid the hope, Sun doctor Carol Cooper sounded a note of caution. She said: "It's wrong to expect too much too soon. Sometimes long-term effects are subtle."

a.west@the-sun.co.uk

Prayer mum dies

EXCLUSIVE

By EMILY NASH

A MUM died of a suspected heart attack while praying for Fabrice Muamba at church.

Christina Goredema, 35, collapsed in front of horrified partner Edward and their four-year-old son and daughter, two.

Friend Artur Correia, at the service in Hillingdon, North West London, on Sunday, said: "She had taken the microphone and was talking about how Fabrice was too young to be this sick, when she fell on to a pastor.

"Someone rushed to try to revive her, but it was no good.

"I was with Edward on Saturday night watching the news about Fabrice and crying. Now Christina is gone. We're in shock."

myView

By VINNIE JONES, Actor trained in CPR

WHAT happened to Fabrice Muamba at the weekend was terrible to see.

It wasn't just footballers, former players, people involved in the game or fans who were affected. What happened made everyone sit up and take notice.

Muamba is the kind of player who roars around the pitch and covers every blade of grass. He has an incredible engine. The effort involved and stress on his heart must have been huge.

It's horrible to see an athlete as strong as that collapsing on the pitch without warning.

I played 500 or 600 games as a professional footballer and I wouldn't have had a clue how to do CPR. I think I once got 30 minutes training at school.

It's a daunting thought for anyone to think they might be faced with a similar situation.

I didn't learn CPR until I filmed the advert for the British Heart Foundation last year. Since the ad was broadcast I've had people coming up to me in the street singing the Stayin' Alive song. We have raised awareness of a serious, serious issue.

The other day the British Heart Foundation heard about a girl who saved her dad's life by doing CPR after seeing our ad.

Last month an OAP in West London saved his next-door neighbour who suffered a cardiac arrest. He only knew what to do because of the TV campaign.

CPR should be taught in schools as part of the curriculum.

Think about all the amateur football matches around the UK. The Sunday morning pub teams are the ones I consider most at risk. They go out and drink into the small hours and turn up for a kickabout at 10am the next day. Their heart rate is sky high and they're battling through a hangover. It's an accident waiting to happen.

I might have a film coming up with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Sly Stallone. Those boys are knocking on a bit. At least I'll be prepared if the action scenes get a bit too heavy for them.

I followed TV ad tips

BRADLEY Fisher saved the life of his neighbour Gerald Barwick, 79 after seeing Vinnie Jones teaching CPR in the TV ad Bradley, 68, of Hounslow, West London, said: "I started pumping his chest to the Stayin' Alive song, just like I'd seen Vinnie doing.

"He'd had a massive heart attack. In hospital they said the CPR probably saved his life."

My cardiac arrest at 13

DANNY Jackson had a cardiac arrest at 13 while playing football at school.

Danny, of Chesham, Bucks, said: "Luckily there were three staff who felt confident enough to help. They took it in turns to give me CPR."

Now 21, Danny works for the Cardiomyopathy Association, which helps heart muscle disease victims.

Hubby was hero twice

TINA Amiss has been saved TWICE by her husband Pete after having cardiac arrests in 1994 and 2001.

Physiotherapist Tina, 48, of Greenford, West London, said: "Thank God Pete knew CPR and resuscitated me.

"I wouldn't be here today without Pete's quick thinking and the support of the Cardiomyopathy Association and the medical staff."
articles.teaser: STRICKEN star Fabrice Muamba was 'in effect dead' for 78 MINUTES after he collapsed on the field from a cardiac arrest
articles.headline: Muamba's dad: They stopped match for you
articles.subdeck: Hope ... Fabrice Muamba

image.caption: Tragic ... Luke Chapman collapsed on pitch

articles.articlebody:
A BOY of 15 has died after collapsing during a rugby match.

Ambulance crews were called after reports Luke Chapman stopped breathing on the pitch.

He was airlifted from Baxter College in Kidderminster, Worcs.

But he passed away shortly after arriving at Birmingham Children's Hospital.

A spokesman for West Midlands Ambulance Service said: "Crews arrived to find a boy who was not breathing and CPR was being carried out.

"Ambulance crews took over resuscitation attempts and advanced life support was carried out at the scene.

"The boy was transferred to Birmingham Children's Hospital by air ambulance for further emergency treatment.

"Unfortunately, despite the best efforts of ambulance crews and hospital staff, nothing could be done to save the boy and he passed away shortly after arriving at hospital."

Luke was a pupil at Haybridge High in Hagley, Worcs. Tony Homer, chair of governors at the school, said in a statement: "We are all terribly shocked and upset by what has happened.

"Our thoughts are with the family and friends at this very sad time. The school will offer all the support we possibly can to those affected."

A spokeswoman for Worcestershire County Council said the school was in a state of shock following the teenager's death on Tuesday.
articles.teaser: A 15-YEAR-OLD schoolboy has died after collapsing during a rugby match
articles.headline: Schoolboy, 15, dies after collapsing at rugby match
articles.subdeck: Tragic ... Luke Chapman collapsed on pitch

image.caption: We're on the case ... George Osborne on the steps of No11 Downing Street this morning
Tanks for nothing - Chancellor ignores calls for fuel duty cut -Anger at 'stealth-tax' on pension allowances

video.caption: CHANCELLOR George Osborne sticks to planned rise in price of petrol
CHANCELLOR George Osborne delivers statement in Commons
LABOUR leader launches ferocious attack in response to Osborne's speech

articles.articlebody:
MOTORISTS and pensioners were hit today in Chancellor George Osborne's 2012 Budget  but millions of low-paid workers were handed a tax break.

Osborne ignored a YouGov poll in The Sun which showed 77 per cent of people wanted him to slash fuel duty.

Instead he declared: "I do not propose to make any further changes to the fuel duty plans already set out."

The Chancellor was also accused of hitting pensioners hard over tax allowances and there was bad news for smokers, with an extra 37p duty on a packet of cigarettes.

But there was some cheer for lower-waged workers as Osborne raised the personal tax allowance to £9,205.

It means low-paid workers get to keep more of their hard-earned cash and could see millions be better off by £220 a year.

There was also good news for high earners. The Chancellor announced the 50p top rate of tax will drop to 45p from April 2013.

As he announced the cut to the 50 per cent rate, Osborne also closed a number of loopholes and reliefs which he claimed would raise five times more from the wealthy.

'Stealth-tax'

But the Government stood accused of an "outrageous stealth tax" after it emerged that more than four million people who are about to become pensioners will be worse off following changes to simplify the tax system unveiled in the Budget.

At the moment, people over the age of 65 are not taxed on the first £10,500 of their income, but this will be frozen for existing pensioners - and from next April new pensioners will have a tax-free allowance of only £9,205, bringing them into line with the general population.

Around half of pensioners will be affected by the changes, which will raise around £1billion annually for the Government.

Saga director-general Dr Ros Altmann said: "This is an outrageous assault on decent middle-class pensioners.

"This Budget contains an enormous stealth tax for older people. Over the next five years, pensioners with an income of between £10,000 and £24,000 will be paying an extra £3billion in tax while richer pensioners are left unaffected.

"There is nothing in this Budget for savers, there is nothing to improve the annuity market, nothing to appease the damage of quantitative easing and nothing to support ISA changes and shelter older people's money in cash. This Budget is terrible news for pensioners."

Meanwhile, the basic state pension will be increased by £5.30 a week.

Mr Osborne had earlier said the Budget would be good for the UK. "This Budget rewards work. Britain is going to earn its way in the world." he told Parliament.

"There is no other road to recovery.

"This Budget supports working families and helps those looking for work.

"It unashamedly backs business. And it is on the side of aspiration: those who want to do better for themselves and for their families.

"This Budget re-affirms our unwavering commitment to deal with Britain's record debts."

The Government's forecast for UK borrowing for 2011/12 was revised down slightly to £126billion. The UK growth forecast was 2 per cent (down 0.1per cent).

Meanwhile the rich were hit by a 7 per cent stamp duty on properties worth over £2million, or a 15 per cent duty if they are sold via companies in 'corporate envelopes'.



AT-A-GLANCE - see the main points of Budget 2012 below



Mr Osborne cut the top rate of income tax to 45p in the pound for all income over £150,000.

He said that the previous top tax rate had raised less money than expected.



The Chancellor stubbornly refused to cut fuel duty, risking the wrath of Britain's motorists.

He said: "I do not propose to make any further changes to the fuel duty plans already set out."



Child benefit is to be reduced gradually when a member of the household starts earning over £50,000.

Mr Osborne said that if someone earned £60,000 child benefit would be removed completely.



Mr Osborne tried to temper his income tax top rate cut with his stamp duty measure.

He announced a hike from five per cent to seven per cent in stamp duty on homes worth over £2million



The Chancellor said figures showed current year public borrowing would come in at £126billion - a billion less than previously predicted.

He added that Office for Budget Responsibility expected net borrowing to fall to £52 billion by 2016-17.



Smokers were hit hard as Mr Osborne slapped an extra 37p on each pack of cigarettes.

On alcohol he said that there would be no further changes to drink duty rates.



Mr Osborne announced £3billion in allowances for drilling new large and deep fields in a bid to open up oil and gas resources to the West of Shetland.

He also pledged to make administrative savings in the carbon reduction commitment scheme and said combined heat and power plants would be exempt from the carbon price floor.



The Chancellor said he would relax Sunday trading laws during the 2012 Olympics and promised tax credits for video games, animation and TV production in the UK.

He also announced the headline rate of corporation tax to be cut further from next month by one percentage point to 24 per cent.



A massive £100million is to be spent on improving army accommodation.The family welfare grant is to be increased and soldiers serving their country will no longer have to pay council tax when they are deployed.
articles.teaser: GEORGE Osborne makes personal tax allowance £9,205 but ignores fuel duty pleas
articles.headline: TANKS A LOT, GEORGE
articles.subdeck: We're on the case ... George Osborne on the steps of No11 Downing Street this morning

article.caption: Gun fiend filmed school bloodbath for sick kicks

video.caption: PROSECUTOR claims suspected gunman has said he will surrender

articles.articlebody:
ARMED cops are preparing to storm an apartment where the suspected Toulouse serial killer is holed up.

Police have been involved in a siege lasting 13 hours with the alleged shooter - named as 24-year-old Mohammed Mera.

Officers could now go in despite earlier reports in France saying Mera had been arrested.

Cedric Delage, regional secretary for a police union, said the suspect has promised to turn himself into police shortly. Delage says if that doesn't happen, police will force their way in to arrest him.

It has been reported that he has since said he will give himself up later this evening.

He refused to surrender this morning and later threw a handgun out of the window and declared he would surrender this afternoon but the situation has reached a stalemate.

The siege in the Croix-Daurade district of Toulouse came two days after a single gunman massacred Rabbi Jonathan Sandler, 30, his sons aged six and three, and a girl of eight at a Jewish school in the city.

He was filmed on CCTV riding a stolen scooter and switching weapons when one jammed.

He also killed three soldiers in two separate attacks in the region last week. The same weapon, a Colt 45, and the same bike were used in all three.

French Interior Minister Claude Gueant said the suspect "wants to take revenge for Palestinian children" killed in the Middle East, and is angry at the French military for its operations abroad.

Gueant said he is thought to be armed with a Kalashnikov assault rifle, a Mini-Uzi 9mm machine pistol and other handguns, but had thrown a .45 pistol he used to murder seven people in recent weeks from the window.

The minister said the gunman had stopped talking to police. He added that French authorities had been monitoring him for years.

Two officers sustained minor knee and shoulder injuries during the shootout and the man's brother has been arrested.

The suspect's mother has also been taken to the scene to negotiate with him. But she refused, saying she "had little influence on him".

Mr Gueant also revealed the gunman said "he belongs to al-Qaeda" and was known to the authorities after spending time in Afghanistan and Pakistan. Cops swooped on the property last night close to the scene of the first attack.

He added: "When they arrived, the wanted individual shot at the door."

As the raid got underway overnight, the bodies of the victims of the latest shooting arrived in Israel for burial today.

The victims were paratroopers Cpl Abel Chennouf, Sgt Imad Ibn Ziaten and Pte Mohamed Legouad.

Then on Monday Rabbi Jonathan Sandler, 30, his sons Gavriel and Aryeh, six and three, and the principal of the Jewish school's daughter Miriam Monsonego, eight, were shot dead.
articles.teaser: FRENCH police exchange gunfire in stand-off with man suspected of killing three people in Toulouse
articles.headline: French cops 'prepare to storm siege flat'

image.caption: Troubled ... retailer Game

article.caption: Troubled Game chain nears collapse
Game group in crisis as supplier pulls plug

articles.articlebody:
GAME GROUP is on the brink of collapse  after admitting it was worthless.

Some 6,000 UK jobs are hanging by a thread after the struggling video games chain suspended its shares from trading in the City.

In a statement the board said it was "of the opinion that there is no equity value left in the group".

It came as electricals specialist COMET put a third of its high street stores up for sale.

Comet is owned by OPCAPITA, the private equity fund trying to strike a deal to save Game.

Sources close to Game told The Sun that OpCapita is struggling to find an agreement with Game's banks  led by ROYAL BANK OF SCOTLAND.

Game, drowning under debts of almost £180million, will go bust this weekend unless a deal can be reached. The group has a £21million rent bill to pay on Sunday and it owes £10million in VAT.

One insider said: "We cannot believe the way the banks have handled this. They seem to want us to fail."

Game's collapse is the latest hammer blow to hit the high street. Big name chains such as PEACOCKS, LA SENZA and BLACKS LEISURE have all collapsed since Christmas.

Game runs more than 600 stores in Britain but has been clobbered by fierce competition for best-sellers from the supermarkets and the rise of internet gaming.

MASS EFFECT 3 hit the top of the video game charts earlier this month  despite maker ELECTRONIC ARTS refusing to supply Game with the release.
articles.teaser: SHARES in retailer Game Group have been suspended on the London Stock Exchange 'pending clarification of the company's financial position'
articles.headline: 'Worthless' Game Group on brink of collapse
articles.subdeck: Troubled ... retailer Game

image.caption: Action man ... helicopter pilot William

articles.articlebody:
PRINCE William has flown back to Britain to be reunited with wife Kate after spending six weeks apart on his RAF mission in the Falklands.

The Duke of Cambridge was sent to the South Atlantic outcrop in February for what would be the longest the couple had ever spent away from each other.

But he arrived back this morning on a short period of leave before he returns to RAF Valley.

A St James's Palace spokesman said: "The Duke arrived today.

"He will have a short period of leave like the rest of his crew, before returning to work at RAF Valley."

William's posting to the islands highlighted growing tensions between Britain and Argentina over them.

Prime Minister David Cameron and Argentine President Cristina Kirchner been at odds in the lead-up to the 30th anniversary of the invasion of the Falklands on April 2.

Argentina accused the UK of "militarising" the dispute by reportedly sending a submarine carrying nuclear weapons to the South Atlantic, something that Britain has not confirmed.

But Britain has insisted any movements of troops and warships were purely routine, and claimed Argentina was trying to impose an "economic blockade" on the Falklands.
articles.teaser: DUKE to be reunited with Duchess of Cambridge after six weeks away with RAF
articles.headline: Wills back home with wife Kate
articles.subdeck: Action man ... helicopter pilot William

image.caption: Heartbroken ... Paul with Isabel

articles.articlebody:
A TRAGIC mum of triplets died in hospital eight days after giving birth.

Isabel Mason, 34, passed away in the Royal Hampshire County Hospital in Winchester after delivering babies Mattias, Lukas and Sarah.

German-born Isabel  known as Izzy - died on March 10 after giving birth to the babies on March 2.

An inquest was opened on March 16 and a possible cause of death given as haemopericardium, which is the rupture of the pericardial sac around the heart caused by a cut in an artery.

Her husband Paul said: "Isabel had delivered healthy triplets - Mattias, Lukas and Sarah - and in the precious week in between had been on top of the world.

"We were both overjoyed to be having an instant family, the triplets were our first and most probably last children.

"We looked forward to sharing and introducing our children to our shared hobbies of family time around the kitchen table, playing guitar, listening to German and French radio, country walks, camping, motorbiking, listening to the rain and watching the world go by.

"Since Isabel's death, I have been overwhelmed with the messages of support and tributes to her and we would like to thank all of our friends and colleagues who have been in touch as these words of comfort and kindness mean so much to our family."

The Winchester couple, who married in 2010, both worked for the Ordnance Survey in Southampton.

A spokeswoman for Hampshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust said: "This is a real tragedy and our thoughts and sincere condolences are with the family who we are supporting at this difficult time.

"Of course, due to patient confidentiality, we are unable to share details relating to a patient's care."
articles.teaser: TRAGIC Isabel Mason lost her life in hospital after delivering her three babies
articles.headline: Triplets mum dies eight days after births
articles.subdeck: Heartbroken ... Paul with Isabel

image.caption: Freed ... Judith Tebbutt

video.caption: JUDITH Tebbutt, abducted from Kenyan resort last September is let go

articles.articlebody:
KIDNAPPED Brit Judith Tebbutt says she is "really happy" to have finally been freed after six months in captivity at the hands of Somali pirates.

She was dramatically released today after being taken hostage in September and is on her way back to Kenya.

She told ITV News: "I'm really happy. It's just nice to be around other people, it's been quietly lonely for seven months."

She was freed after a ransom was paid by her relatives, according to reports.

Judith, from Bishop's Stortford, Herts, was snatched from the country by an armed gang who shot her husband dead.

The social worker, 56, was taken from the remote Kiwayu Safari Village beach resort "kicking and screaming" after husband David, 58, was shot in the chest with an AK47.

A speedboat took her into lawless Somalia where pirates held British yacht couple Paul and Rachel Chandler for 13 months.

The couple's son, Oliver, declined to comment today but a friend of Mr Tebbutt said it sounded like "wonderful news".

Somali pirate Bile Hussein and Mohammed Hussein, an official with the militia Ahlu Sunnah Wal Jama, said Judith, was released by pirates holding her today and was expected to be flown to the Kenyan capital Nairobi.



David was a publishing exec with Faber & Faber and was a member of the Book Trade Charity.

Its chief executive David Hicks knew him for 15 years and said today: "This sounds wonderful, though I'll only really be happy when it's definite that she's safe."

Local MP Richard Harrington, from Watford, told Sky News: "Our thoughts are with Oliver, who must have such feelings today. Under the circumstances, he's done absolutely fantastically.



"To see his parents go on holiday, and saying he'll see them in a couple of weeks' time, in the most routine way that happens to all of us, then to find what happened to his father, and his mother, for so long whereabouts unknown, I'm sure he's got the deepest emotional feelings today, that none of us will ever experience in our lives, but I think he's conducted himself for one so young so extremely well, and I do nothing other than just commend him."

A team of Metropolitan Police officers travelled to Kenya to help authorities investigating the case.
articles.teaser: SOCIAL worker 'is free' after six months in captivity at hands of Somali pirates
articles.headline: Somali pirates 'have released' kidnapped Brit Judith Tebbutt
articles.subdeck: Freed ... Judith Tebbutt

image.caption: Accident ... Val d'Isere

articles.articlebody:
A YOUNG Brit working in a ski resort has been killed on the slopes.

The 22-year-old resort representative was skiing with several colleagues on a day off when he fell and collided with a snow-making cannon in Val d'Isere, France.

His firm, Crystal Ski, said: "Crystal Ski regrets to confirm that a member of staff was involved in a fatal ski accident at Val d'Isere at 12pm on Tuesday.

"No one else was involved in the accident. His friends who witnessed the fall immediately alerted pisteurs and a doctor attended the scene, but the young man was declared dead."

The company, a division of travel firm TUI, said it was helping make arrangements for the family to fly out to France.

It has also sent a counsellor to help staff who witnessed the incident.

A spokesman said: "Our thoughts are with the family, friends and colleagues at this very difficult time."

The French authorities and the British Consulate in France have been informed.
articles.teaser: THE 22-year-old worked at ski resort and collided with snow cannon on day off
articles.headline: Brit dead in skiing accident
articles.subdeck: Accident ... Val d'Isere

image.caption: Lift off ... birdman Jarno Smeets

video.caption: DUTCHMAN allegedly flies 100 meters in self-designed 'bird-wings'

articles.articlebody:
THE Sky seems to be the limit for this inventive birdman who claims to have mastered human flight.

Jarno Smeets straps movable wings to his back and takes off after flapping them like a bird.

It appears the engineer soars up into the air, gliding for 100 metres before making a gentle landing after 30 seconds.

After his feat, Jarno said: "This was the best moment in my entire life."

But the video was creating some turbulence online as some viewers doubted its authenticity.
articles.teaser: VIDEO: MECHANICAL engineer Jarno Smeets claims to have mastered human flight
articles.headline: Birdman 'masters' human flight
articles.subdeck: Lift off ... birdman Jarno Smeets

image.caption: The saddest convoy ... hearses pass through Carterton

video.caption: BODIES of fallen British heroes killed in Afghanistan return to the UK

article.caption: Emotional memorial service for Britain's six fallen heroes
Army chief: We must stand firm in Afghanistan
Fallen heroes' comrades vow: We'll get job done ... we owe it to the guys we have lost
Daddy's a star in heaven
So young
Commanding officer's tribute to 'six of our fallen brothers'

articles.articlebody:
SIX hearses pass 2,000 mourners yesterday, bearing fallen heroes coming home from the worst attack on British forces in Afghanistan.

War veterans lowered flags, families sobbed and well-wishers broke from silence into spontaneous applause as the sad convoy passed.

The bodies of Cpl Jake Hartley, 20, Pte Anthony Frampton, 20, Pte Christopher Kershaw, 19, Pte Daniel Wade, 20, Pte Daniel Wilford, 21, and Sgt Nigel Coupe, 33, were flown back a fortnight after a Taliban bomb tore into their Warrior armoured vehicle.

Pte Wade's pregnant girlfriend Emma Hickman  due to give birth to their daughter Lexie in three months  placed a teddy and rose on his hearse.

Friends and family of Pte Frampton wore T- shirts with his picture beneath the word "Hero".

His mum Margaret Charlesworth had "My Beautiful Boy" written on hers.

Natalie Overton, 20, of Huddersfield  who dated his comrade Pte Wilford  said: "They were lovely people. It's an amazing turnout, they'd be proud."

The victims of the deadliest attack in the war's 11 years were flown to RAF Brize Norton, Oxfordshire. The younger five were from 3 Battalion The Yorkshire Regiment. Sgt Coupe was from 1 Battalion, The Duke of Lancaster's Regiment.

After a private service, the Union Jack-draped coffins were driven past crowds 30-deep at dusk to a memorial garden in nearby Carterton.

Brenda Hutsby, 60  at the roadside with friends  said: "We've come to pay our respects. It's my way of saying thank you for everything they've done for us."

  • FACTORY worker Azhar Ahmed, 19, yesterday denied posting "grossly offensive" messages on Facebook two days after the soldiers died. Ahmed, of Ravensthorpe, was bailed by magistrates in Dewsbury, West Yorks.
articles.byline: By DAVID WILLETTS and CAROLINE GRANT
articles.teaser: FALLEN heroes flown back to the UK after the worst attack on Brit forces in Afghanistan
articles.headline: 2,000 salute 6 Afghan heroes
articles.subdeck: The saddest convoy ... hearses pass through Carterton

image.caption: Arrest ... stunning Simone Farrow

articles.articlebody:
A FORMER Penthouse babe accused of being a DRUGS ring boss has been arrested after almost a month on the run.

Blonde beauty Simone Farrow, 37, was wanted for fleeing £100,000 bail by cops investigating a Hollywood trafficking gang.

The stunning model was extradited to Sydney on Wednesday night after she was nicked at a cheap hotel on the Gold Coast Highway in eastern Australia.

She stands accused of trafficking ice  a nickname for crystal meth  in bags of bath salts from her Tinsel Town high-rise apartment, off Sunset Boulevard.

Farrow, who has posed in a series of skimpy outfits in her modelling days, arrived in Sydney Airport flanked by two cops.

She pleaded her innocence as she got there and claimed she only ran away because "someone was trying to murder" her.

Farrow has now been remanded in custody on charges which include the alleged 2009 drug operation.

She is said to have at least 19 aliases and a long-lost teenage daughter but by skipping bail she had put the £100k surety at risk.

Court documents also show that she had legally changed her surname to Lawson in November.

Police have charged her with importing "ice" into Australia and allege she was the brains behind an "ongoing criminal enterprise" that involved at least seven people.

One member of the alleged syndicate committed suicide in a Hollywood motel the day after being contacted by US authorities.

It is claimed Farrow allegedly developed a method of hiding the drugs inside the bath products.
articles.teaser: BLONDE model Simone Farrow was found by cops after a month on the run
articles.headline: Penthouse babe in 'drugs' bust
articles.subdeck: Arrest ... stunning Simone Farrow

image.caption: Eye opener ... Brown and Bercow

article.caption: Ed Balls makes a jibe at Gordon Brown's PM effort
Grafters 'tired of Labour'
Gordon Brown's £1.4m bonanza

articles.articlebody:
GORDON Brown may have been reminded of the plunging economy under his leadership as he appears to glance at Sally Bercow's low-cut top.

The former PM sat beside the Speaker's wife as the Queen addressed Parliament to mark her Diamond Jubilee.

The ex-Labour leader's wife Sarah sat on his other side.

But two other spouses were notably absent  David Cameron's wife Samantha and Nick Clegg's wife Miriam.

Eyebrows were raised as the PM and his deputy attended the historic occasion alone.

But a Downing Street spokesman said: "Spouses didn't need to attend. Mrs Cameron was at work."

A Lib Dem spokesman said lawyer Mrs Clegg was working abroad and unable to get home for the event.
articles.teaser: GORDON Brown appears to glance at Sally Bercow's low-cut top during Queen's speech
articles.headline: Fiscal stimulus Gordon?
articles.subdeck: Eye opener ... Brown and Bercow

image.caption: Bed joke ... Obama and Cameron

article.caption: Cam dunk in US
PM plea on Brits' US trials
Don't be a fool ... cut fuel
Samantha Cameron pays tribute to 9/11 victims

articles.articlebody:
DAVID Cameron joked yesterday that he was "tucked up in bed" by President Barack Obama on his US visit last week.

The Prime Minister revealed that Mr Obama offered him his bed on his official Air Force One jet as they flew back to Washington from a basketball match in Ohio.

Mr Cameron quipped: "I don't think that's happened before!"

The PM told business leaders in Oxfordshire: "It was about 4am UK time, so he said, 'David, why don't you use my bed and put your feet up?'

"So I duly did. Barack went to the back of the plane and explained to my private secretary and the team, 'Don't worry, the British Prime Minister is fine, I've just tucked him up in bed'."

Mr Cameron also joked that he struggled to hold First Lady Michelle Obama's attention at a White House banquet.

He said: "The man on her other side was George Clooney.

"I found it quite difficult to compete."
articles.teaser: DAVID Cameron revealed that Mr Obama offered him his bed as they travelled during US trip
articles.headline: PM: I was tucked in bed by Obama
articles.subdeck: Bed joke ... Obama and Cameron

image.caption: U-turn ... Harrier jump jet

article.caption: Britain's battle plan for war with Iran
Help poor heroes
Our boys to blitz Somalia pirates

articles.articlebody:
BRITAIN may be left without an aircraft carrier all year round for DECADES due to a fighter jet bungle.

A key Anglo-French deal to share warships has been thrown into doubt by a U-turn over the type of planes Britain will use.

Under the 2010 agreement between David Cameron and Nicolas Sarkozy, both nations would be able to land its aircraft on the other's carrier.

The cost-cutting move would ensure we retained round-the-clock strike capability at sea.

But Britain is preparing to abandon a new generation of conventional fighters in favour of Harrier-style jump jets  despite former Defence Secretary Liam Fox ditching Labour's plans for jump jets in 2010 on cost grounds.

His decision meant the new carrier would have to be converted to a "cats and traps" system to launch the conventional jets and catch them when they land. Scrapping that would save taxpayers £1.75billion.

But it also would mean French Rafale jets could not land on the UK's Queen Elizabeth class carrier.

Experts also say British jump jets could not take off from French carriers if carrying weapons. Shadow defence secretary Jim Murphy said: "The rushed defence review is falling apart."

The MoD said a decision would be announced "shortly".

k.schofield@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: ANGLO-FRENCH deal to share warships thrown into doubt by a U-turn over planes
articles.headline: Warship deal is sinking fast
articles.subdeck: U-turn ... Harrier jump jet

image.caption: Strictly comb dancing ... Jason Donovan's new head of hair, right, and before, left

article.caption: Andrew's Lording it on talent show
Chelsee Healey is a fashion disaster
Jason Donovan: I'm radical ...I sleep naked

articles.articlebody:
SINGER Jason Donovan has ended one of pop's great mysteries  by admitting he HAS had a hair transplant.

The former chart star owned up to having the same surgery as footballer Wayne Rooney.

His confession came as he was tipped to join ex-girlfriend Kylie Minogue at a concert to celebrate the 1980s. Strictly star Jason, 43, was forced to confess his surgery after blurting it out in front of a packed audience during filming for Piers Morgan's Life Stories on Saturday night.

He told The Sun: "I am really happy with the results. It's something I did just for myself and haven't felt the need to publicise it."

Jason has always refused to divulge his hair transplant treatment despite it looking thicker on Strictly. A pal said last night: "This is not just Jason being vain. He is a guy who works in showbusiness and he feels more comfortable with hair.

"Piers was being cheeky about his hair apparently thickening and he let slip that he'd 'done a Rooney'."

Jason is set to join Kylie, 43, on stage to sing their 1989 No1 Especially For You at a concert in London's Hyde Park on July 11.

c.robertson@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: SINGER ends one of pop's great mysteries  & admits he HAS had a hair transplant
articles.headline: Donovan: I've stuck hair on
articles.subdeck: Strictly comb dancing ... Jason Donovan's new head of hair, right, and before, left

image.caption: Charge ... Anna Ryder Richardson with husband Colin MacDougall

articles.articlebody:
TV presenter Anna Ryder Richardson is being prosecuted after a toddler and his mum were crushed at her zoo.

Teacher Emma Davies-Hughes, 28, and her son Gruff, three, were visiting the star's wildlife park when a tree branch fell in strong winds.

Gruff suffered serious head injuries and his mum, from Llanelli, Carmarthenshire, was also badly hurt.

He is still having treatment after the incident in Tenby, West Wales, in August 2010.

Ex-Changing Rooms star Anna, 48, was said to have been "devastated" by the accident in the wallaby enclosure.

Pembrokeshire County Council confirmed yesterday that Anna and her husband Colin MacDougall face two charges of breaching the Health and Safety Act.
articles.teaser: PRESENTER Anna Ryder Richardson prosecuted after branch fell at her wildlife park
articles.headline: TV Anna accused over zoo
articles.subdeck: Charge ... Anna Ryder Richardson with husband Colin MacDougall

image.caption: Who's that girl ... Jenna-Louise Coleman

article.caption: Karen Gillan's the Dr Ooh girl
Dr Who and pals get exterminated
Baby joy for Emmerdale's Natalie Anderson
Who's next to fight the Doctor?

articles.articlebody:
FORMER Emmerdale lesbian Jenna-Louise Coleman has today been named as Dr Who's new assistant  as we first revealed last night.

The pretty 25-year-old impressed bosses with her screen test and chemistry with star Matt Smith.

This morning show boss Steven Moffat said: "We saw a lot of brilliant actresses. But Jenna was the only person going faster than Matt - he had to keep up!

"It always seems impossible when you start casting these parts, but when we saw Matt and Jenna together, we knew we had our girl. She's funny and clever and exactly mad enough to step on board the TARDIS.

"It's not often the Doctor meets someone who can talk even faster than he does, but it's about to happen."

And teased: "Jenna is going to lead him his merriest dance yet."

Jenna-Louise will take over when Karen Gillan, who plays Amy Pond, leaves the hit BBC sci-fi drama this year.

The actress, who also stars in ITV1's new big budget Titanic drama this Sunday, is best known as Emmerdale's Jasmine Thomas.

She said: "I'm beyond excited, I can't wait to get cracking; working alongside Matt I know is going to be enormous fun and a huge adventure."

She will first be seen on screens at Christmas.

Moffat also confirmed that Doctor Who will air six episodes in 2012 and a further eight in 2013 for the show's 50th anniversary.
articles.teaser: ACTRESS is fave for role after impressing chiefs with screen test & chemistry with Smith
articles.headline: 'Dale Jen new pal for Dr Who
articles.subdeck: Who's that girl ... Jenna-Louise Coleman

image.caption: MY HEAD'S STRAIGHT ... Tevez, pictured in training yesterday, has impressed boss Mancini
Carlos Tevez is back - and he is perfect, says Mancini

video.caption: MAN CITY boss says side can triumph in last 10 games - and be champs

article.caption: Mancini title roar
Sturr crazy for Joe 'n Petr
Mancini's worried we don't check enough
Thanks Fer nothing

articles.articlebody:
ROBERTO MANCINI is ready to unleash Carlos Tevez after claiming the Argy is a changed man.

Tevez, 28, will be on the bench for Manchester City's game with Chelsea tonight  the first time since his Munich bust-up with Mancini last September.

The City boss said: "In training, Carlos has been perfect and better than last year.

"He wants to play and help the team and his attitude is better. I have always thought Carlos is a top player, even when we had a problem.

"What happened with him six months ago is in the past.

"For the last month he has been part of our plans and for the next two months he will be a City player.

"Carlos wants to play football after six months  for his future he needs to play again."

Mancini admitted he does have trouble in defence again tonight.

Vincent Kompany has a calf injury and Joleon Lescott a hip problem.

The duo have missed the last two games and will not face Chelsea.

Mancini added: "It could be a big problem."
articles.teaser: CITY boss ready to unleash Carlos Tevez after claiming the Argy is a changed man
articles.headline: Tevez is perfect
articles.subdeck: MY HEAD'S STRAIGHT ... Tevez, pictured in training yesterday, has impressed boss Mancini

image.caption: MESSIAH ... Lionel celebrates becoming Barcelona's record goalscorer
Messi vs Ronaldo - We reveal our verdict on who the world's greatest player is

articles.articlebody:
LIONEL MESSI'S astonishing feats at Barcelona must make Cristiano Ronaldo's blood run cold.

As Barca boss Pep Guardiola said last night: "I am sorry for those who are trying to usurp Leo's throne but it's impossible."

Messi's hat-trick against Granada turned him into Barcelona's record goal-scorer at just 24 as he overtook the legendary Cesar and now stands at 234 goals in all competitions.

But Ronaldo deserves some sympathy.

Real Madrid are top of La Liga, five points clear of Barca, which could turn to eight tonight with their game in hand at Villareal.

The Madrid megastar is on the verge of reaching 100 Liga goals in fewer than three seasons at the Bernabeu.

He has 99 in 90 matches and even the fantastic Ferenc Puskas needed 105 games to reach a Liga century for Real.

The most expensive footballer of all time has notched up 129 strikes in 129 games for Madrid since his £80million move from Manchester United.

And last season Ronaldo broke the all-time Liga record with 40 goals.

Those are jaw-dropping feats that justify the eye-watering sum Madrid president Florentino Perez coughed up.

Now ask yourselves this:

Whose name has been talked about more than anyone else's all season?

Whose name is associated constantly with the unofficial title of "the best player of all time?"

Not Ronaldo. The answer, of course, is Messi.

Ronaldo, for all his superlative stats, is not even part of the conversation.

But that is not because of some conspiracy or propaganda.

It is because while Ronaldo rattles them in, goal-machine Messi's Barcelona have been winning the trophies.

It is because whenever Messi's Barcelona faced Ronaldo's Madrid in any competition they prevailed  apart from the Copa del Rey final last year when the Portugal star headed the extra-time winner.

It is because this was Real's ONLY win against the Catalans in the four seasons Guardiola has been in charge and the three Ronaldo has been in Madrid.

It is because since Ronaldo's arrival Madrid have failed to beat Barcelona in La Liga.

It is because the Catalans outclassed Madrid in last year's Champions League semi-final both on and off the pitch.

Remember Jose Mourinho's Special tactics  more kung-fu than football  to stop Barca playing?

And his "why, why, why" monologue that accused UEFA of pro-Catalan corruption and earned him a four-match ban after Guardiola's men had beaten them 2-0 at the Bernabeu to all but secure their place at Wembley's final?

It is because this year  with Real runaway Liga leaders  Barcelona came to the Bernabeu and won 3-1 staging another exhibition, despite Real's 1st-minute opener through Karim Benzema.

It is because when Barcelona went to the Bernabeu a few weeks later in the Copa del Rey they won 2-1 and subsequently dumped Madrid out after a 2-2 draw at the Nou Camp.

Last year Ronaldo fired 53 goals in all competitions. Messi stopped at 52 but lifted the Champions League and La Liga while Ronaldo had just the Spanish Cup to show for a splendid season.

Ironically Ronaldo arrived at the Bernabeu as...the Messiah.

I sat in the middle of the pitch with the rest of the world's media as he came out on stage and all I remember are the decibel levels created by 85,000 that had crammed into every corner of the Bernabeu  and the 10,000 locked out around Real's historic stadium.

Since then, individually, Ronaldo has produced fireworks to match the fiesta of that balmy July evening in the summer of 2009.

Let's not forget even Ronaldo's last game for United was a loss against Messi, who headed the second as Barcelona buried the Red Devils in the Champions League final in Rome.

Ronaldo arrived at the Bernabeu as the reigning World Player of the Year after scoring 42 goals for United in his penultimate season and winning the Premier and Champions League double (after dumping Barca out in the semis).

But since joining Madrid he has seen Messi win the crown of the world's best player THREE times. Even when Spain won the World Cup Messi was STILL voted the No1 on the planet.

Ronaldo's character and perseverance must be praised as he has kept going and improving where many would have wilted.

But since he's gone to Madrid he has only won the Spanish Cup.

In that time Messi has won TEN trophies  two Ligas, a Champions League, two European Supercups, two club World Cups and three Spanish Supercups.

In 11 matches head-to-head, Barcelona have won seven and drawn three while Madrid have only won ONE.

So to answer the question on who I think the world's greatest player is, I have to choose the Argentine.

And that's because Messi scores as many goals and has won many more trophies and almost every Clasico.

The fact is Ronaldo has won 10 trophies at the age of 27. Messi has won 18 at the age of 24.
articles.byline: By ANTONY KASTRINAKIS, European Football Correspondent
articles.teaser: ANTONY KASTRINAKIS explains why Lionel Messi pips Cristaino Ronaldo every time
articles.headline: Ron's the Real deal...but Messi is the world's best
articles.subdeck: MESSIAH ... Lionel celebrates becoming Barcelona's record goalscorer

image.caption: GOLDEN OLDIE ... but Patrick Vieira has questioned the return of Paul Scholes

article.caption: Mancini's worried we don't check enough

articles.articlebody:
PATRICK VIEIRA has turned up the heat in the title race by claiming the return of Paul Scholes this season proves Manchester United are WEAK.

The former Manchester City midfielder, who is now the club's fotball development executive, believes Scholes coming out of retirement in January aged 37 shows their rivals are struggling.

He said: "Paul Scholes is a player that I really love and admire, one of the best English players of the last few years, and seeing him come back is good for him and for United.

"But for him to come back just shows a little bit of weakness in United, because they had to bring a player back who was 37.

"I think it shows that, in the next few years, it will be really difficult for United to cope with other teams because, with all the respect I have for Scholes, him coming back shows that they don't have talent in there to replace him.

"When you see United losing young players like Ravel Morrison and maybe Paul Pogba, they should be really worried because that wouldn't have happened in the past."
articles.teaser: MAN CITY official has turned up the heat in title race by questioning squad depth
articles.headline: Vieira: Scholes return shows weakness
articles.subdeck: GOLDEN OLDIE ... but Patrick Vieira has questioned the return of Paul Scholes

image.caption: RECORD BREAKER ... Lionel Messi is now Barcelona's all-time top goalscorer

video.caption: PEP Guardiola praises Leo Messi comparing him to the basketball great

articles.articlebody:
BARCELONA boss Pep Guardiola has compared record breaker Lionel Messi to basketball legend Michael Jordan.

Messi became Barca's all-time leading goalscorer after hitting a hat-trick in last night's 5-3 win over Granada.

The Argy has now scored an incredible 234 times for the Catalans  and is still just 24 years of age.

When asked if Messi already deserves to be ranked alongside all-time sporting greats like basketball hero Jordan, Guardiola said: "Maybe, yes.

"There have been very few like them in history, who dominated their sport like that.

"Messi is the best and he shows it every three days. I'm sorry for the others, but this boy is something different.

"I'm sorry for those who want to compete for Messi's throne. It's impossible  this boy is the best."

Fellow Barcelona star Gerard Pique reckons Messi can now be regarded as the greatest footballer EVER.

The Spanish centre-back said: "It's a pleasure to be in the same generation as him.

"I believe he's the best player in the history of the sport.

"I've been lucky enough to be on the same team as him, I consider myself privileged.

"It doesn't matter where he plays, whether it's cold or hot, he always proves that he's the best."

Messi's treble against Granada means he has now scored 54 times in 45 matches in all competitions this season.

Graphic couresty of Voetbal International and @MessiStats
articles.teaser: PEP GUARDIOLA has compared Lionel Messi with basketball legend Michael Jordan
articles.headline: Pep: 'Dominant' Messi is the best
articles.subdeck: RECORD BREAKER ... Lionel Messi is now Barcelona's all-time top goalscorer

image.caption: BACK TO FOOTBALL ... Owen Coyle's side will face Blackburn this weekend

article.caption: Amir has Fab wish
Abidal in Fab tribute

articles.articlebody:
BOLTON have confirmed their game against Blackburn this week WILL go ahead.

And the club are also set to fulfil their FA Cup quarter-final with Tottenham, after Sunday's clash at White Hart Lane was halted by Fabrice Muamba's cardiac arrest.

Boss Owen Coyle said: "We spoke together with the players as a group this morning and I talked with Fabrice's family last night.

"Fabrice's father Marcel and his fiancee Shauna were keen that we fulfil our fixtures.

"Once the players knew this, there was no doubt in our mind that we would play the matches."

The re-arranged cup game has now been set for Tuesday March 27 at 7.30pm.
articles.teaser: BLACKBURN game will go ahead  as well as FA Cup quarter-final with Spurs
articles.headline: Bolton ready to play again
articles.subdeck: BACK TO FOOTBALL ... Owen Coyle's side will face Blackburn this weekend

image.caption: WAITING GAME ... Nemanja Vidic is targeting pre-season training

article.caption: Vieira: Scholes return shows weakness
Berba's a slow go
Rio and Lampard in Chinese takeaway

articles.articlebody:
NEMANJA VIDIC says he is on course for a return to action with Manchester United at the start of next season.

Vidic ruptured his cruciate ligament during December's Champions League defeat to Basel.

The 30-year-old was immediately ruled out for the remainder of the campaign, but revealed today his target is pre-season training in the summer.

He said: "My recovery is going well.

"Obviously the projection was I would be ready for the next season. I am on schedule and will hopefully start training again in July."
articles.teaser: CROCKED defender is targeting pre-season training for return from knee injury
articles.headline: Vidic: I'll be back next season
articles.subdeck: WAITING GAME ... Nemanja Vidic is targeting pre-season training

image.caption: WARNING ... Mario Balotelli

article.caption: Vieira: Scholes return shows weakness

articles.articlebody:
MARIO BALOTELLI could miss Italy's European Championship campaign  unless he curbs his temper.

Italian boss Cesare Prandelli left the Manchester City star, 21, out of his squad for last month's friendly defeat to the United States for disciplinary reasons.

The Azzuri chief claimed the three red cards Balotelli has received while playing for City this season was the reason for his omission.

And Prandelli has warned the striker he faces being left out of the 23-man squad for the tournament in Poland and Ukraine this summer.

He said: "In my head, Balotelli is a starter.

"But he still needs to show that he's got the personality and capacity to handle this pressure."
articles.teaser: MAN CITY striker told to curb his temper or risk missing Euro 2012
articles.headline: Balotelli told: Curb temper or face Euro KO
articles.subdeck: WARNING ... Mario Balotelli

image.caption: CONFIDENT ... Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger

article.caption: We're Gunner turn up the heat
Say Aymen to that

articles.articlebody:
ARSENE WENGER reckons Arsenal have the mental strength to hold off the challenge of Chelsea and seal a place in the top four.

The Gunners face Everton tonight full of confidence having won their last five Premier League matches.

Victory at Goodison Park could see them leapfrog bitter rivals Tottenham into third spot if Harry Redknapp's men fail to beat Stoke.

And boss Wenger has urged his stars to keep their recent run of good form going into the last 10 games of the season.

He said: "It is a key time. The fixtures are difficult for Arsenal, Chelsea and Tottenham.

"It will be about who does the best and they will be the team who focus on the next game and the next result.

"Last season we were in four different competitions and we were knocked out of three in the space of two weeks. We are only human beings.

"On top of that, some results were really going against us, you think about the last minute against Liverpool at home and about Tottenham when we were up.

"These two results killed the hope we had to play for the title and from then on we felt, subconsciously, too secure that we were in the top four of the league anyway.

"Once you don't go for the championship any more it's different.

"This season it's totally different, we were completely out of the top four, we have come into it on a good run and now, of course, it is taking advantage of that momentum."

Arsenal set a Premier League record against Newcastle by becoming the first team to win from a losing position in four successive matches.

Wenger added: "Every time we were behind and every time we have shown outstanding spirit.

"It's not fantastic for your emotions but overall when it finishes well you accept suffering.

"If that's the price we have to pay we are ready but you just want to continue with the same attitude because I don't believe in luck too much on that side of the game.

"Then again, it is how much are you ready to give? How much commitment can you give in every game? How focused can we be?"
articles.teaser: ARSENE WENGER says Arsenal's run of good form will see them book top four spot
articles.headline: Wenger: We'll seal top four spot
articles.subdeck: CONFIDENT ... Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger

image.caption: SPOT THE BALL ... Vittorio Esposito intentionally spoons his penalty over

video.caption: STRIKER spoons spot-kick over in remarkable act of sportsmanship

articles.articlebody:
SPORTSMANSHIP is a rare commodity in football these days but here is proof that fair play does still exist in the beautiful game.

This memorable moment came in a match between Torres and US Termoli in the Coppa Italia Dilettani  the Italian Amateur Cup.

After a 2-2 draw in the first leg, Termoli were already one goal ahead in the second leg when they were awarded a last minute penalty after Vittorio Esposito took a dive in the box.

Torres players were furious and the penalty would give the hosts a chance to seal their place in the next round.

But in one of the greatest displays of sportsmanship in recent years, a guilt-ridden Esposito deliberately spooned the ball up and over the bar.

The Italian's gesture was warmly received by Torres even though they were still dumped out of the cup 3-2 on aggregate.

And while we're at it...

This video reminded us of another legendary moment back in 1997 at Highbury.

Referee Gerald Ashby awarded Liverpool a penalty when Robbie Fowler went down under a challenge from David Seaman.

But the Reds striker pleaded to the ref not to give it as Seaman had not made contact.

Ashby claimed he hadn't heard Fowler's appeals and stuck to his guns and while Fowler missed the pen, Jason McAteer was on hand to tuck in the rebound.
articles.teaser: SPORTSMANSHIP is a rare commodity in football these days but here is proof that fair play does still exist in the beautiful game
articles.headline: Italian spoons pen on purpose
articles.subdeck: SPOT THE BALL ... Vittorio Esposito intentionally spoons his penalty over

image.caption: WINNING NOTE ... The Samsung Note has a 5.3in Super AMOLED display, 1.4GHz Dual Core Processor and 8MP camera

articles.articlebody:
ROBERT DI MATTEO takes his Chelsea side to Portugal to face Benfica at the Estadio da Luz on Tuesday March 27.

And thanks to Samsung, Chelsea's Official Sponsors, you and a friend could fly out with the Blues' players on their private plane  then get the full VIP treatment at the match!

This fantastic offer includes return flights from Gatwick, transfers, a night in a luxury hotel AND a new Samsung Galaxy Note mobile phone for the winner.

The amazing Samsung Galaxy Note features a 5.3" Super AMOLED display and an 8MP camera, and enables you to create, edit and share notes with the S-pen.

What is the name of Benfica's stadium?

a) Estadio da Portugal

b) Estadio da Luz

c) Estadio da Benfica

To enter simply email your answer together with your name, age and daytime telephone number to giveusayell@newsint.co.uk and put "Chelsea VIP competition" in the "Subject field".

If you're not lucky this time around, but still want to see the match action, simply log on to www.facebook.com/samsungfootball

The competition closes at 3pm on Thursday, March 22, 2012 when a winner shall be drawn from those entrants supplying the correct answer to our question above.

All entries are subject to The Sun's competition terms and conditions. Click here to view.

Additional terms and conditions:

Competition closes at 3pm on Thursday, March 22.

Winner will be contacted by Samsung by midday on Friday March 23.

Please provide a daytime contact telephone number.

Winner and guest must both be over 18 and have valid passport to travel from Tuesday March 27.

There is no cash alternative
