articles.headline: Win VIP trip to Benfica v Chelsea and latest Samsung Note mobile
articles.subdeck: WINNING NOTE ... The Samsung Note has a 5.3in Super AMOLED display, 1.4GHz Dual Core Processor and 8MP camera

image.caption: OUT OF FAVOUR ... Juventus winger Milos Krasic

articles.articlebody:
MILOS KRASIC has admitted he made a mistake turning down a move to Tottenham in January.

The Juventus midfielder confessed snubbing a loan switch to White Hart Lane was the wrong option.

And he has opened the door for Harry Redknapp to make a renewed offer in the summer after declaring his intention to quit Serie A.

Serbian international Krasic, 27, has fallen out of favour under Juve boss Antonio Conte.

The winger said: "It's obvious that I have been written off and there is no place for me here so all I can do is keep working hard to stay fit and look for a new club at the end of the season.

"There were offers from Zenit St Petersburg and Tottenham during the January transfer window to join them on loan.

"But I decided to stay at Juve because I believed I would get another chance here.

"Obviously, that was an-ill judged decision and it turns out I would have been much better off if I had left."

Krasic, who can play on either flank, scored nine goals in 41 appearances for Juventus in his first season at the club.

But he has netted just once in nine games this term. He added: "I am very sad to be leaving Juventus, no one would be happy to leave such a great club under these circumstances.

"But Conte has scrapped me and it's best for everyone that I leave."
articles.teaser: JUVENTUS winger Milos Krasic admits he was wrong to snub Tottenham
articles.headline: Krasic: I should have joined Spurs
articles.subdeck: OUT OF FAVOUR ... Juventus winger Milos Krasic

image.caption: ANGUISH ... Spurs players react to Muamba's collapse

article.caption: Harry: Spurs are playing well
Muamba collapse gave me flashbacks of Foe
Prem to launch full medical review
Taylor reveals PFA's £7m screening policy
Mancini's worried we don't check enough

articles.articlebody:
HARRY REDKNAPP will look his players in the eye before deciding whether they are in the right frame of mind to play tonight.

The Tottenham manager has revealed his squad saw a counsellor at the club's Essex HQ on Monday following the collapse of Fabrice Muamba at White Hart Lane.

Redknapp is trying hard to make it business as usual for the Premier League clash against Stoke but admits he doesn't know how his stars will react following the shock of seeing Muamba fight for his life on the pitch at the Lane.

He revealed: "A lady came in. She had a quick chat with them. They all seemed OK yesterday.

"But I'll look at them and see who looks...you can soon tell when they're training if their mind's on it or they don't look like they're into it, for any reason.

"If they're not I'll have a chat with them then. If they come out and they look bright then there's no problems.

"If there is anybody who today feels they are not in the right frame of mind to play, then obviously I would not play them. I won't take a chance."

Redknapp found it difficult to sleep following Saturday's shocking scenes but admitted the improvement in Muamba's condition has lifted his spirits after he hit rock bottom.

He was back at Tottenham's training ground at 7.30 am yesterday following a three hour drive from his home in Poole, Dorset, trying to make training as normal as possible.

But Redknapp looked far from his usual self, adding: "I didn't sleep well at all on Saturday, none of us could believe what we had seen. It was all surreal, "It has knocked me low, knocked me flat for two or three days. It does seem to be one thing after the other recently. And it does take its toll.

"But things are really, really positive following Muamba's improvement. We're not on a low today, we're on a high with it.

"We need a win against Stoke, it's a massive game for us. We can't afford to lose any games, we've got to be ready to play. We can't come off and say 'we got the game out of the way'.

"Sometimes the best thing is to get back on the bike if you fall off, and we need to do that, we need to get going again."

Spurs have lost their last three matches and their 10 point lead over Arsenal has now eroded to just one but Redknapp remained defiant, insisting:

"We have had a run of not good results, but they have not been bad performances. We are not playing badly, but we need it a result and want to be in form against Stoke.

"If we don't win, then things are really getting a bit tight. It has closed up and you have to make sure we try to pick up three points."

Stoke winger Matthew Etherington goes back to his old club saying: "We've got to finish the season strongly now we're out of the FA Cup.

"We deserve to finish in the top 10. I don't think anyone can argue with that. We missed out on that on the last day of last season at Wigan.

"If we can make sure this time around, then I think we can say it's been a successful campaign."
articles.teaser: STARS get counselling over Fabrice Muamba collapse as boss decides if they can play
articles.headline: Spurs aces counselled
articles.subdeck: ANGUISH ... Spurs players react to Muamba's collapse

image.caption: TEMPERS FLARE ... Ryan Taylor and Kieran Richardson go head-to-head

articles.articlebody:
NEWCASTLE and Sunderland have been fined by the FA for failing to control their players during a stormy derby clash.

The Toon have been punished to the tune of £40,000 as it was their second incident of a similar nature this season, while the Black Cats will have to pay half that amount.

Both clubs have also been warned as to their future conduct, following the scenes at St James' Park on March 4.
articles.teaser: BOTH clubs punished for failing to control players in Tyne-Wear derby
articles.headline: Newcastle and Sunderland hit with FA fines
articles.subdeck: TEMPERS FLARE ... Ryan Taylor and Kieran Richardson go head-to-head

image.caption: DITCHED ... Fernando Torres
Fernando Torres set for Chelsea axe

article.caption: Sturr crazy for Joe 'n Petr
Mancini's worried we don't check enough
Tevez is perfect

articles.articlebody:
FERNANDO TORRES will be back on the bench tonight despite ending his five-month Chelsea goal drought at the weekend.

Boss Roberto Di Matteo plans to field his strongest side at Manchester City.

And that means Didier Drogba is almost certain to get the nod over Torres for the lone striker's role.

Di Matteo admitted: "It's great to have such fantastic firepower available and it hurts to leave out players of this calibre.

"It will be tough on whoever is left out but I can only fill 11 positions so I must look at the form of the players and see which team best suits us to win the game."

Torres, 28 yesterday, is desperate to play after hitting two in Sunday's 5-2 FA Cup win over Leicester, his first goals since October.

And his Spain and Blues team-mate Juan Mata reckons Torres has finally regained faith in his scoring skills.

The Chelsea wideman admits his team-mate felt the pain during his drought.

Mata said: "He went through a tough period. He was suffering because he was not scoring. He is playing more often now and he is regaining trust in himself."

Mata is also backing a rejuvenated Torres to force his way into the Euro 2012 side as Spain defend their title.

He added: "In the end, I think Torres will be at the Euros, He has enough credit to play for Spain."
articles.teaser: ROBERTO DI MATTEO plans to field his top side at City  and that means no Torres
articles.headline: Thanks Fer nothing
articles.subdeck: DITCHED ... Fernando Torres

image.caption: EYES ON THE PRIZE ... Roberto Mancini

video.caption: MAN CITY boss says side can triumph in last 10 games - and be champs

article.caption: Having Tev back will be like getting a major signing
Dzeko quit fear
Evans above, I'll be a Blues fan

articles.articlebody:
ROBERTO MANCINI has declared: Manchester City WILL win the title.

The City boss saw his side surrender top spot 10 days ago to bitter rivals Manchester United.

They are four points back after the Red Devils trounced Wolves 5-0 on Sunday and face a resurgent Chelsea at the Etihad tonight.

Many believe City have already blown it.

But Mancini roared: "We will win the title.

"I am confident because the players are very strong and they know we have a big chance to win this title.

"I also think we deserve this after being top for seven months. We dominated this championship until one week ago, so we don't want to lose this chance to win."

Mancini believes if his side can replicate their stunning start to the season in the final run-in, they will triumph  with a derby against United at the Etihad still to come on April 30.

He said: "In the first 10 games we won nine and drew one, against Fulham.

"Until now we have had a fantastic Premier League campaign and we need to continue like this.

"It's better to always stay on the top. But I said a month ago it could be that we go second as we have difficult fixtures, different to United.

"We have everything in our hands. We have 10 games and need to win those 10 games."

While United have all the experience of winning titles, Mancini believes his players have the same desire.

He said: "We know United are used to staying there always. This is the one difference between us and United at the moment.

"The players need to win it for themselves, not for me . . . for them and for the club. For the same reasons, I want to win this championship."

City's spirit came under the spotlight in the 1-0 defeat at Swansea 10 days ago when Gareth Barry showed open dissent to the management after being subbed.

Barry did not apologise, but Mancini said: "No, but Gareth is a good guy.

"He was probably disappointed because to leave a game after 30 minutes is not good for any player, but we didn't have a problem with him."

Mario Balotelli and Yaya Toure were also heard arguing in the tunnel at half-time.

But Mancini says it would be madness to let any internal divisions derail City. It is time to pull together.

He said: "If they don't do this, they are not a professional player. Many players here have never had a chance like this to win the title."

After defeats away to Sporting Lisbon and Swansea, City did get back on track to some extent with a 3-2 return-leg win in the Europa League last week  although they still went out on away goals.

Remember, too, they have not dropped a point at home in the league this season.

Mancini faces fellow Italian Roberto Di Matteo, who has overseen a revival at Stamford Bridge after replacing the axed Andre Villas-Boas.

Interim Chelsea boss Di Matteo boasts four wins out of four and has even got Fernando Torres scoring!

Mancini said: "I am happy for Torres because I like the guy and I like the player. He deserved this.

"Roberto has done very well. Chelsea are a good team, but they were a good team under Villas-Boas. But it's clear that when you change manager, the players can give more."

After Chelsea this evening, City travel to Stoke on Saturday before United host Fulham on Monday.

Mancini added: "If we win our next two games, we go two points up. We need to go our way and can't think about United."

And City skipper Vincent Kompany insisted: "I don't think there are many clubs in Europe with a better future.

"I've been here since the beginning of the adventure and it's personal now."

Kompany also reckons his Belgium international team-mate Eden Hazard could be City's next David Silva.

Mancini watched Hazard at the weekend and was impressed as the 21-year-old Lille ace scored twice against Valenciennes. United and Spurs are also interested.

Asked which of the two playmakers he would prefer, Kompany said: "Silva now, Hazard in five years' time.

"With his talent, Hazard could succeed anywhere."
articles.teaser: CITY sit four points behind rivals United  yet Mancini is convinced they will win title
articles.headline: Mancini title roar
articles.subdeck: EYES ON THE PRIZE ... Roberto Mancini

image.caption: GRIN IT TO WIN IT ... Robin van Persie

article.caption: Say Aymen to that
Wenger: We're all praying for Fabrice

articles.articlebody:
ROBIN VAN PERSIE has told Arsenal to crank up the heat on their top-four rivals.

The red-hot Gunners have stormed into the Champions League spots with an incredible run of five straight wins.

Van Persie & Co could even snatch third spot from Spurs if they win at Everton on Wednesday night.

And the Dutch marksman said: "It is tough to play the way we all want.

"We need to be consistent and get a win over the line, like at Liverpool.

"We did it now, and we can enjoy it, but we need to show it again at Everton and it may even be a harder game, but we have to give it our maximum and see where it ends."

Incredibly, Arsenal were trailing in FOUR of those five victories  including a dramatic last-gasp win over Newcastle.

And Van Persie added: "If you look at the last couple of weeks, we showed we have a lot of character in our side, and we can be proud of that.

"Now we need to show that over a period of a whole year. We need to have a run like that for months and even win the ugly games.

"We showed signs that we can do it because against Liverpool we didn't play well, but still nicked it.

"We came from behind in the past four games and ended up winning the game. That shows we can do it, not only once or twice or three times, but lots of times. So why not show it 20 times or whenever it is needed?"

Meanwhile, Arsene Wenger remains hopeful that Jack Wilshere could return before the end of the season.

Wilshere is yet to pull on an Arsenal jersey this year.

But Gunners boss Wenger added: "It is difficult to set a deadline on Jack.

"We go week by week with him, but his last scan was very good so we don't have to worry any more.

"It is about progress and fitness, however I can't set a date."
articles.teaser: VAN PERSIE & Co could snatch third spot from Spurs if they win at Everton on Wednesday
articles.headline: We're Gunner turn up the heat
articles.subdeck: GRIN IT TO WIN IT ... Robin van Persie

image.caption: MESSIAH ... Lionel Messi celebrates his opener against Granada

article.caption: Lionel Messi is highest-paid star in the world

articles.articlebody: LIONEL MESSI has broken the all-time goal record for Barcelona  aged just 24. The Argentine genius hit a hat-trick in the 5-3 win over Granada in La Liga. The goals saw the little magician surpass the tally of 232 set by Cesar Rodriguez during his spell at the Catalan club from 1939-1955. Messi's first goal was a crisp half-volley that flew in off the post after good work down the left from youngster Isaac Cuenca. His record-breaker came midway through the second half as he tucked away Dani Alves' through ball. And his treble came from another Alves cross as he struck home from inside the six-yard box, taking his season total to 54. Messi is widely regarded as the finest player of his generation and has been awarded the Ballon D'Or three years in a row. Under the stewardship of boss Pep Guardiola, Messi has become the talisman of the current Barcelona side which is arguably the greatest club team in history. His medal collection  both team and individual  is astonishing and includes five La Liga titles and three Champions Leagues. His greatest goal involved a mazy run from inside his own half against Getafe in 2007  reminiscent of fellow countryman Diego Maradona's unforgettable goal against England in the 1986 World Cup. And at such a young age, there's no telling how many he could score  he may even have targeted Pele's mammoth total of more than 1000 goals.
articles.teaser: LIONEL MESSI has broken the all-time goal record for Barcelona  aged just 24
articles.headline: Messi breaks goal record for Barcelona
articles.subdeck: MESSIAH ... Lionel Messi celebrates his opener against Granada

image.caption: COMEBACK KID ... Danny Cipriani

article.caption: Cipriani set to join Sale Sharks

articles.articlebody:
DANNY CIPRIANI has been warned he faces a fight to resurrect his England Test career.

The seven-times capped Melbourne Rebels fly-half, 24, is joining Sale on a three-year deal this summer.

England caretaker chief Stuart Lancaster said: "He's coming back into a pretty competitive position in fly-half.

"When you look at the strides that Owen Farrell has made during the Six Nations, to Charlie Hodgson's contribution  and Toby Flood's a high-quality player."

Lancaster says he would be happy to lead England on their tour to South Africa this summer if the RFU have not made a permanent appointment. He added: "If no one is in place I'd be delighted."
articles.teaser: STUART LANCASTER warns Danny Cipriani that he is well back in the pecking order
articles.headline: Cip warned
articles.subdeck: COMEBACK KID ... Danny Cipriani

image.caption: ON THE BUTTON ... McLaren driver Jenson Button expects Red Bull to be stronger this week

article.caption: Fernandes finds reasons to be cheerful
Alonso aims to be a raining champ
Red-dy for battle

articles.articlebody:
JENSON BUTTON thinks Red Bull will be back to their very best in Malaysia this weekend.

The McLaren driver dominated in Melbourne to win the season's first Formula One race with team-mate Lewis Hamilton also finishing on the podium in third.

Red Bull's Sebastian Vettel and Mark Webber picked up second and fourth respectively but were off the pace for much of the weekend.

And Button is expecting his title rivals to be much improved this Sunday as he bids to make it back-to-back wins.

He said: "There are a few cars that maybe didn't get the best out of what they had at the weekend.

"I'm sure Red Bull are going to be massively quick this race. I don't think qualifying went very well for them, and Seb put his car in the gravel in practice.

"But they were quick in the race, so they're going to be there.

"It's developing what you have and getting the best out of what you have, and they haven't yet, but then I'm not sure we have either.

"It's not just McLaren at the front, we have a lot of competition and that's exciting for us."

There has been talk that the new McLaren MP4-27 may not fare as well in the humid heat of Malaysia as it did in the cool climes of Melbourne.

But Button believes his team will have done all the prep-work necessary to get the car right up to speed for the weekend.

He added: "Within the team we've talked about Malaysia, and obviously it's a very different place than Melbourne.

"I think a lot of people had problems warming up their tyres in Melbourne, whereas we won't have that problem in Malaysia due to the heat.

"So it's finding a good set-up for that circuit and consistency is going to be tricky. It's something really to work on for us.

"But I can't see any reason why we can't get this car working in the heat as well as the cool, as was the case at the weekend when the sun was going down.

"We've a very good understanding of the car, and there's still more to come, but we've only driven it in cool conditions.

"It might completely change when we get to Malaysia, and I'm sure it will, so we've got to be thinking ahead of the game.

"We can't turn up there and think 'we'll just send it out and see what happens'. We'll hopefully be ready for it."
articles.teaser: JENSON BUTTON thinks Red Bull will be back to their very best in Malaysia this weekend
articles.headline: Button expects Red Bull test
articles.subdeck: ON THE BUTTON ... McLaren driver Jenson Button expects Red Bull to be stronger this week

image.caption: TONS OF FUN ... Jonathan Trott and Andrew Strauss

article.caption: Broad fitness fear

articles.articlebody:
ANDREW STRAUSS and Jonathan Trott struck centuries on day two of England's pre-Test warm-up  but Ian Bell's struggles continued on a flat pitch in Colombo.

Responding to the Sri Lankan Development XI's 431-6, the England openers shared a stand worth 197, both retiring upon reaching three figures to allow others some time at the crease.

But Bell, who had a woeful time against Pakistan and lasted just two balls in his previous innings on tour, fell tamely for 14 to leave him well short of runs ahead of next week's first Test.

Strauss declared with his side 159 behind, improving Bell's chances of a second bat on the final day, and the hosts finished on 44-1.
articles.teaser: ANDREW STRAUSS and Jonathan Trott set themselves up for Test series with runs
articles.headline: Strauss and Trott hit centuries
articles.subdeck: TONS OF FUN ... Jonathan Trott and Andrew Strauss

image.caption: Gripping ... she pulls Jimmi Harkishin close

article.caption: Corrie Anne: I'm most hated in Britain
Corrie's Tommy sees his flesh and bloody
Corrie's Sophie Webster 'to become a crack addict'
Corrie's Sue Nicholls: 'Audrey is making a mistake'
Coronation for Royle Family Sue Johnston

articles.articlebody:
CORRIE'S Jimmi Harkishin has struck up a bizarre friendship with a hardcore porn actress.

The Street favourite  who has played shopkeeper Dev Alahan for 13 years  took porn star Kat Lee along to a showbiz premiere as his date.

The pair attended the first night of musical Chicago at Manchester's Palace Theatre with other TV celebs.

Kat, 25, has starred in a series of no-holds-barred adult films  with titles including Sex Dolls and Sugar Daddy. At the start of the night, brunette Kat arrived at the theatre alone, followed around 30 seconds later by Jimmi, 52.

But once inside the foyer, they were spotted cuddling up as they headed to the bar. The pair then sat together as they watched the show.

Afterwards, they were spotted in Jimmi's car sharing a bag of chips.

An onlooker in the theatre said: "A few people know who this girl is and they were shocked to see her there with Jimmi. But he didn't seem to care. He had his arm around her and was introducing her to people in there. He tried to cover things up by making her walk separately from him. But then they sat in a car eating chips."

Later the pair were spotted heading to Kat's city centre flat and Jimmi didn't leave until well after midnight.

Yesterday all Kat would say was: "I was at the show with him but I don't want to talk about it."

In 2008, Jimmi claimed his crazy days were behind him.

He said: "I can't drink. I can't stay up too late. But I actually like getting older."

At the height of his troubles, in 2004, Jimmi was suspended from his £100,000-a- year role in Corrie after being caught taking cocaine with a girlfriend.

Jimmi's love life has been just as colourful as his character Dev's. He was caught several times cheating on his former long-term partner and mum of his two children Susan Beaton.

A source said: "Jimmi keeps his love life very close to his chest.

"But now it looks like he and Kat are getting close. He has always had a colourful love life."
articles.teaser: JIMMI  who plays Dev  strikes up a bizarre friendship with a hardcore porn actress
articles.headline: Porny Dev-il
articles.subdeck: Gripping ... she pulls Jimmi Harkishin close

image.caption: Kat fight ... Hollywood A-lister Gwyneth Paltrow

article.caption: Kate gives us an eyeful
Kate Moss is Absolutely Fabulous in new role
Kate is shawl-y the best
Stew's that girl?
Beyonce will Gywn and bear holiday grub
A Girl Like Me (plus one)

articles.articlebody:
KATE MOSS lives her life like she's still at school  ruling her gang of mates with a fag in her hand.

But every now and then someone steps up and challenges her super-cool authority, like good old Gwyneth Paltrow.

The Hollywood actress put Kate in her place in spectacular fashion at Sir Philip Green's 60th birthday party in Mexico during a bit of verbal sparring on the beach.

And the put-down was straight out of a comedian's top drawer. A source said: "Gwyneth had gone for a jog on the beach before the big birthday bash. Kate was out for a walk, eating crisps, when Gwyneth ran past.

"Kate said, 'Oi, what you out jogging for?' Gwyneth fired back, 'So I don't look like you when I get old'. Kate was speechless for a second then spat back and threw some crisps at her. She said, 'Why don't you eat some f****** carbs!'

"The spat was the talk of the dinner. Everyone was having a giggle about it.

"Kate is seen as queen of the cool crowd but not everyone falls into line."

I always thought Gwyneth was a bit timid  but she has earned my respect for that one. It's a classic.

Topshop boss Philip put together his usual A-list line-up for the bash. He had Kate Hudson and Matt Bellamy, Gwyneth and Chris Martin, Kate and Jamie Hince, plus Robbie Williams, Stevie Wonder  and loads more.

Piers Morgan has been moaning about how the model kicked him in the shins when they met at a dinner. In future he should take Gwyneth as security.

She now has the honour of owning very rare Kate Moss kryptonite. If she could bottle it, Philip Green could make a fortune selling it.
articles.teaser: HOLLYWOOD actress's model put-down is talk of Sir Philip Green's 60th birthday party
articles.headline: Gwyneth pal row
articles.subdeck: Kat fight ... Hollywood A-lister Gwyneth Paltrow

image.caption: Float like a butterfly, sting like a Bieber ... Justin Bieber's boxing photoshoot
Un-Bie-lievable ... Justin the fighter

article.caption: Justin Bieber's mum spills the beans
Birthday boy Bieber buys £7million love nest - rented by Ashton Kutcher
Bieber goes green as he turns 18
Bieber's 'no texting' dangerous driving warning
Justin and Selena play happy families
Bieber's baby bro

articles.articlebody:
PRETTY boy Justin Bieber gets battered and bloody in a new video.

The 18-year-old boy-next-door is seen beaten and bruised after getting whacked in the face by a boxer.

The uncharacteristically dark scenes are the work of fashion photographer Tony Kelly for US publication Complex.

A beat-up Bieber is seen getting hit in the jaw and spitting out clots of blood while dressed in a ripped-up white tuxedo and polka-dot bow tie.

The usually-angelic teen is also nursed by a hot Lycra-wearing ring girl and at one point, Bieber holds a lump of meat against his black eye.

He's then seen getting the beefy boxer in a headlock and hitting another emerging opponent on the head with a glass bottle.

During the interview alongside the shoot, Bieber tells Complex about his ride with the fame game and where he gets his drive from.

He says: "There's no point in doing this if I'm not going to be the best.

"I give up a personal life. I give up my friends and family to pursue what I love and to make my fans happy. Why would I give up so much to be just another singer?"

And he even opens up about his cagey relationship with Selena Gomez and why they can't keep it private forever.

He says: "There's no way to hide the relationship completely, because then it would be unfair to us.

"At that point, it's not even a relationship. You're just hiding from everyone. That's unfair and unhealthy, man."

And with regards to his tough boy shoot where he's seen to be a blood-stained mess, he tweeted: "You should of seen the other guy."

As if we'd Bie-lieve that.
articles.teaser: JUSTIN Bieber gets beaten up and bloody in his new shoot
articles.headline: Justin gets Bie-ten up
articles.subdeck: Float like a butterfly, sting like a Bieber ... Justin Bieber's boxing photoshoot

image.caption: The long and short of it ... Emma Watson with new barnet on set of The Bling Ring

article.caption: Emma Watson is Bling Ring burglar
Harry Potter star has £31m in the coffers
Emma Watson's a real shape-shifter
Emma Watson wows at premiere

articles.articlebody:
EMMA Watson has had a magical transformation  after her locks went from short to long overnight.

The Harry Potter star did not wave a wand to achieve her new look  the brunette hair extensions are for her latest film role.

Emma, 21, cut her hair short after wrapping the final movie in the boy wizard series in a bid to distance herself from Hermione Granger, the character she had played for ten years.

But she got her long tresses back as she started working on The Bling Ring on set in LA, California.

Despite the glorious sunshine, the British beauty was wrapped up in a padded coat, pink tracksuit bottoms and Ugg boots as she began filming the Sofia Coppola movie at the beginning of the week.

It is based on a real gang of celebrity-obsessed teenagers who burgled the homes of their idols  including Lindsay Lohan, Megan Fox and Orlando Bloom.

The gang, who were also known as the Hollywood Hills Burglar Bunch, bagged nearly £2million in cash and jewellery before being arrested in 2009 and subsequently jailed.
articles.teaser: HARRY Potter star gets long hair extensions as she begins filming new movie The Bling Ring
articles.headline: Emma Watson's magic new look
articles.subdeck: The long and short of it ... Emma Watson with new barnet on set of The Bling Ring

image.caption: Popular with men ... Madonna writhes around with dancers

article.caption: Looking Madg-nificent
'Adele fat? That is ridiculous. She's great, how much she weighs has nothing to do with it'
Madonna rolls back the years on new album

articles.articlebody:
MADONNA bathes in a sea of oily topless men in the video to her new single Girl Gone Wild.

The pop stalwart, 53, is in the shape of her life as she gyrates and throws shapes in a range of flesh-flashing black clobber.

She shows off her enduring fitness, nailing some unusual push-up moves while pressing her heeled feet against a wall.

Madonna also gives plenty of screen time to her army of semi-naked and ripped male dancers.

The track is the debut release from her upcoming 12th studio album MDNA  her first since 2008's Hard Candy.

We're streaming the entire album on our website this Friday.

MDNA  which has already been picking up glowing reviews  also features the singer's 15-year-old daughter Lourdes performing backing vocals on the tune Superstar.

Madonna recently admitted she struggles to balance her career with raising her four children Lourdes, 15, Rocco, 11, David, six, and five-year-old Mercy, five.

width="560" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/PPwDws5hzuU" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen>

She said: "I'm not going to lie  it's hard work having four kids and doing all the work I do.

"Sometimes I cope with it very well. Sometimes it's a struggle."

The pop veteran  who's dating 24-year-old dancer Brahim Zaibat  vents her fury at ex-hubby Guy Ritchie in the track I Don't Give A.

She sings: "I tried to be a good girl/ I tried to be your wife/ Diminished myself/ And I swallowed my light.

"I tried to become all/ That you expect of me/ And if it was a failure/ I don't give a [bleep]."
articles.teaser: POP veteran writhes around with topless dancers in video to Girl Gone Wild
articles.headline: Madonna has a buff time in her new video
articles.subdeck: Popular with men ... Madonna writhes around with dancers

image.caption: Quite a team ... Brian May and Dappy

article.caption: Tulisa and Dappy Twitter war over N-Dubz split
What 'jungle man' Dappy can learn from Bear

articles.articlebody:
ROCK legend Brian May has enlisted an unlikely ally in his mission to save badgers  N-Dubz star Dappy.

The Queen guitarist, who has been working with the singer on his new track Rockstar, has been campaigning for years to protect the woodland animals.

And now it seems his affection for the furry animals has rubbed off on Tulisa's cousin.

May has long been battling to save the badgers after the Welsh Government revealed it was due to carry out trial exterminations to see if it helped the spread of bovine tuberculosis (TB) in cows.

But now he has roped in some celebrity pals to back him up.

He said: "I've had support from Slash (ex-Guns 'n' Roses guitarist) as well as Dappy."

It's since been announced that the scheme is being axed and replaced with more badger-friendly vaccinations.

And rock musician-turned astrophysicist May couldn't be more happy about it.

The 64-year-old added of his odd rapper ally: "When we were working on his new single together, I asked him about the issue to see what he thought.

"His feeling was it was a moral issue and that sacrificing thousands of innocent animals to try and solve this problem is a terrible last resort."

N-ything you say, Brian.
articles.teaser: BRIAN May and N-Dubz star Dappy fight to save badgers
articles.headline: Brian May badgers Dappy into saving mammals
articles.subdeck: Quite a team ... Brian May and Dappy

image.caption: Kills and spills ... Kate Moss and Jamie Hince
Kate pops out - She is human ... skinny Moss has belt and zip undone

article.caption: Gwyneth pal row
Kate gives us an eyeful
Kate Moss is Absolutely Fabulous in new role

articles.articlebody:
HAS Kate Moss been munching too many crisps and fancy dinners?

The skinny supermodel had her belt and zip undone as she went for a stroll with hubby Jamie Hince.

Either she's feeling bloated after a good meal or the newlyweds were overcome with passion on their London outing.

She shared a laugh in the spring sunshine with The Kills rocker Jamie, who she wed in July last year.

But she seemed unaware that her skinny jeans were undone.

The 38-year-old was munching on some ready salted crisps when she had a recent spat with super-healthy Gwyneth Paltrow and told her to "eat some f****** carbs!"

The pair met in Mexico as they celebrated Sir Philip Green's 60th birthday.

A source said: "Gwyneth had gone for a jog on the beach before the big birthday bash. Kate was out for a walk, eating crisps, when Gwyneth ran past.

"Kate said, 'Oi, what you out jogging for?' Gwyneth fired back, 'So I don't look like you when I get old'. Kate was speechless for a second then spat back and threw some crisps at her. She said, 'Why don't you eat some f****** carbs!'

"The spat was the talk of the dinner. Everyone was having a giggle about it."

Let's hope Kate saw the funny side.
articles.teaser: SUPERMODEL has belt and jeans undone as she strolls in London days after spat with health freak Gwyneth Paltrow
articles.headline: Regretting those carbs Kate?
articles.subdeck: Kills and spills ... Kate Moss and Jamie Hince

image.caption: Bit of an Eiffel ... Katy Perry at the Montana Club in Paris

article.caption: Katy's black and blue
Russell Brand shows he's a mummy's boy at heart
Camo Katy is fighting fit for latest release
What's all the Russ about?

articles.articlebody:
KATY Perry slips out of a Paris nightclub after spending the evening with "new man" Baptiste Giabiconi.

The Firework star, who is rumoured to be dating the Chanel model, looked stunning in a skin-tight blue dress, that matched her blue-hair, which was pulled into an impressive updo.

But she was careful not to be spotted with Baptiste, and they left separately after a romantic night together at the Montana club.

The pair arrived at the city's Eurostar station, Gare Du Nord, yesterday, after travelling from London.

They met during Paris Fashion Week earlier this month  a year after 22-year-old Baptiste vowed to wed Katy, as soon as she split from then-husband Russell Brand.

He told a fashion magazine: "If I could make her divorce her husband, I'd marry her."

Designer Karl Lagerfield is thought to have played cupid for the couple at the annual fashion event.

A source said: "Karl has a father and son relationship with Baptiste  he discovered him in 2008.

"He told Katy that Baptiste would be perfect for her and he was right as the pair hit it off straight away."

Katy, 27, may be enjoying the company of the sexy fashion model but marriage is the furthest thing from her mind.

After bumping into a hen night party at Mahiki in London this weekend, the singer, whose marriage to the Brit comic ended at Christmas, told the bride-to-be: "Don't do it."

Bad luck, Baptiste.
articles.teaser: BLUE-haired singer enjoys night out with Baptiste Giabiconi, the model rumoured to be her new man in Paris
articles.headline: Katy's Perry romantic trip to the City of Love
articles.subdeck: Bit of an Eiffel ... Katy Perry at the Montana Club in Paris

image.caption: Shock rocker ... Marilyn Manson has agreed to play at Johnny Depp's son's 10th birthday party

video.caption: JOHNNY DEPP sets sail from Liverpool to start a new life in America

article.caption: Darkest Depps
Johnny's Depp-arting Europe amid Vanessa Paradis split rumours
Vanessa Paradis: Me and Johnny haven't split up
Solo Vanessa Paradis riddle of split pea
Johnny looks Deppart

articles.articlebody:
JOHNNY Depp was never going to book just a straightforward clown for his son Jack's tenth birthday party.

The Pirates Of The Caribbean actor has hired a man once accused of buying a child's skeleton and smoking human bones  Marilyn Manson.

The crackpot singer roped Johnny into guesting on a version of Carly Simon's 1972 hit You're So Vain on his upcoming new album Born Villain.

To return the favour Marilyn has agreed to play at Jack's birthday next month.

Marilyn  who has also been accused of devil worship and encouraging violence  told MTV News: "We did a cover version together of a song which we thought was ironic for each other.

"Johnny played the drums and lead guitar and I played guitar and sang.

"Johnny's son Jack, whose birthday I'm gonna perrform at, was in the room and played on the song too.

"It's pretty cool. The video will probably be us looking at each other like a mirror."

The song could be the most unusual accompaniment to a game of pass the parcel in the history of kids' entertainment.

The odd couple have been pals for years after meeting when Marilyn was an extra on Johnny's Eighties cop series 21 Jump Street.

Just as well  it could test their relationship when all the kids leave the party in tears.
articles.teaser: JOHNNY DEPP would never book just a straightforward clown for his son's birthday
articles.headline: My eeeeek! with Marilyn
articles.subdeck: Shock rocker ... Marilyn Manson has agreed to play at Johnny Depp's son's 10th birthday party

image.caption: Who's that girl ... Jenna-Louise Coleman

article.caption: Karen Gillan's the Dr Ooh girl
Dr Who and pals get exterminated
Baby joy for Emmerdale's Natalie Anderson
Who's next to fight the Doctor?

articles.articlebody:
FORMER Emmerdale lesbian Jenna-Louise Coleman has today been named as Dr Who's new assistant  as we first revealed last night.

The pretty 25-year-old impressed bosses with her screen test and chemistry with star Matt Smith.

This morning show boss Steven Moffat said: "We saw a lot of brilliant actresses. But Jenna was the only person going faster than Matt - he had to keep up!

"It always seems impossible when you start casting these parts, but when we saw Matt and Jenna together, we knew we had our girl. She's funny and clever and exactly mad enough to step on board the TARDIS.

"It's not often the Doctor meets someone who can talk even faster than he does, but it's about to happen."

And teased: "Jenna is going to lead him his merriest dance yet."

Jenna-Louise will take over when Karen Gillan, who plays Amy Pond, leaves the hit BBC sci-fi drama this year.

The actress, who also stars in ITV1's new big budget Titanic drama this Sunday, is best known as Emmerdale's Jasmine Thomas.

She said: "I'm beyond excited, I can't wait to get cracking; working alongside Matt I know is going to be enormous fun and a huge adventure."

She will first be seen on screens at Christmas.

Moffat also confirmed that Doctor Who will air six episodes in 2012 and a further eight in 2013 for the show's 50th anniversary.
articles.teaser: ACTRESS is fave for role after impressing chiefs with screen test & chemistry with Smith
articles.headline: 'Dale Jen new pal for Dr Who
articles.subdeck: Who's that girl ... Jenna-Louise Coleman

image.caption: Strictly comb dancing ... Jason Donovan's new head of hair, right, and before, left

article.caption: Andrew's Lording it on talent show
Chelsee Healey is a fashion disaster
Jason Donovan: I'm radical ...I sleep naked

articles.articlebody:
SINGER Jason Donovan has ended one of pop's great mysteries  by admitting he HAS had a hair transplant.

The former chart star owned up to having the same surgery as footballer Wayne Rooney.

His confession came as he was tipped to join ex-girlfriend Kylie Minogue at a concert to celebrate the 1980s. Strictly star Jason, 43, was forced to confess his surgery after blurting it out in front of a packed audience during filming for Piers Morgan's Life Stories on Saturday night.

He told The Sun: "I am really happy with the results. It's something I did just for myself and haven't felt the need to publicise it."

Jason has always refused to divulge his hair transplant treatment despite it looking thicker on Strictly. A pal said last night: "This is not just Jason being vain. He is a guy who works in showbusiness and he feels more comfortable with hair.

"Piers was being cheeky about his hair apparently thickening and he let slip that he'd 'done a Rooney'."

Jason is set to join Kylie, 43, on stage to sing their 1989 No1 Especially For You at a concert in London's Hyde Park on July 11.

c.robertson@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: SINGER ends one of pop's great mysteries  & admits he HAS had a hair transplant
articles.headline: Donovan: I've stuck hair on
articles.subdeck: Strictly comb dancing ... Jason Donovan's new head of hair, right, and before, left

image.caption: Anger ... Simon Cowell, left, wants David Walliams, right, to avoid Tom Jones' The Voice

article.caption: Simon Cowell: Britain's Got Talent is cooler
Tom Jones's Voice is fine, but he's hard of Jiear-ing
Simon Cowell: 'BGT is so cool'
A Hol' lot of love
Will.i.am blasts Beeb backstage with bass
X Factor is going back to basics

articles.articlebody:
THE rivalry between The Voice and Britain's Got Talent stepped up a gear last night after Simon Cowell BANNED David Walliams from going to see the new BBC show.

Little Britain star David wanted to attend one of the live shows the Beeb's new £22million singing contest will stage later in the run.

He was keen to take his mum Kathleen, 68, to see Welsh crooner Tom Jones, who is on the show's judging panel.

As frequent visitors to Strictly Come Dancing, David and his mum were hoping to get tickets.

But after Simon found out, BGT judge David decided against the move for fear of antagonising his new boss and being branded a TRAITOR.

An insider told TV Biz: "Simon is gunning for The Voice.

"He wants to destroy it and is really unhappy that it's going up against BGT.

"He doesn't want anyone associated with his show being linked with The Voice  and that includes being seen sitting in the audience.

"If David turned up, the BBC would use loads of shots of him in the audience and viewers would think he preferred The Voice.

"It's a battlefield mentality  you're either with Simon or against him. There are no half measures."

David, pictured above with Simon and Tom, often takes his devoted mum to showbiz events and he even roped her in to help with one of his decisions on BGT.

At the Hammersmith Apollo auditions he couldn't make his mind up about a young classical singer.

He said: "This sounds like the kind of thing I'd buy my mother for Mother's Day. Then, turning round, he called out to his mum, saying: "My mum's in the audience  Mum, would you be happy with that?"

TV Biz revealed how BGT bosses brought forward the start date for this year's series in a bid to strangle The Voice at birth.

The sixth season of the ITV1 talent trawl was due to start on March 31.

But once executives discovered its rival was launching a week earlier, they moved the launch date forward.



Alesha on the Loose

BRITAIN'S Got Talent bosses had Alesha Dixon parachuted in as a guest on ITV's Loose Women after hearing The Voice star Danny O'Donoghue was due to appear.

Judge Alesha was called in to join the girls on Friday amid fears Danny would grab too much publicity for the new BBC rival.

A source said: "It really is war now. Where The Voice goes, BGT is lurking in the shadows. It would be funny if it wasn't so ridiculous."

STRICTLY'S Craig Revel Horwood has criticised Alesha for not telling the other judges she was quitting the show. Craig said: "It was a shock because we found out through the Press. I was a bit disappointed. I wish she had texted or called."

But he still wishes the singer well in her debut on Britain's Got Talent, on Saturday. He said: "Good luck to her. I hope it works out."
articles.teaser: BGT judge keen to see Tom Jones in action for BBC but backs down to avoid Si's fury
articles.headline: Judge and fury
articles.subdeck: Anger ... Simon Cowell, left, wants David Walliams, right, to avoid Tom Jones' The Voice

image.caption: Surprise choice ... Engelbert Humperdinck

article.caption: Engelbert's Eurovision song is revealed
Is this the worst Eurovision song ever?
Engelbert: I'll win Eurovision Song Contest
Lulu: I didn't do That with Jason Orange
Fans get the Hump at UK Euro entry

articles.articlebody:
EUROVISION star Engelbert Humperdinck says he still gets knickers thrown at him during performances  despite being 75 years old.

The crooner, a surprise choice to represent the UK at the annual song contest in May, insists he remains a sex symbol to many women.

He said: "I still occasionally get knickers thrown at me, yes.

"I think it is the people that want to be noticed."

He joked: "What I should do is throw mine at them."

The old smoothie, who says he feels more like he is in his fifties than his eighth decade  claims he has never had cosmetic surgery, but admits he dyes his locks.

He said: "I certainly hope I don't act or look my age and I certainly haven't been into any Beverly Hills surgeries. I've got my mother and father's genes.

"When I was 25 I had grey hair. I said to myself, 'If I am going to be in showbusiness I can't go out there with grey hair as a young man.'

"So I started dying my hair really jet black and I created the image with the sideburns. I've been dyeing my hair ever since."

"Lately it has got a little lighter. I don't want to be black-haired at the age of 75."

Despite his fame the Brit  who lives in Los Angeles for part of the year  insisted he is down to earth and loves nothing more than a pint of bitter when he is back in the UK.

He said: "I love the beer. When I come home I must get it out of my system by having a pint of bitter and bag of crisps.

"I say to my driver, 'Pull over', and I stop at a pub."

Bizarrely, Engelbert plans to take a dartboard to the May 26 song contest in Azerbaijan.

The star said: "I love darts. I take a board wherever I work around the world."

His bid for Eurovision glory suffered a blow yesterday when it was revealed the UK's entrant will sing FIRST, often one of the worst slots as viewers may have forgotten the song by voting time.

Bookies lengthened his odds to win from 14-1 to 16-1, making him the eighth favourite.

He admitted: "It is tough to come out of the box first but that's what I have to accept.

"If your first impression is a good one hopefully this will carry through the competition."

Engelbert's Eurovision song  called Love Will Set You Free and likened by some to the Big Fat Gypsy Weddings theme tune  was released on Monday. He said: "My aim is to keep it classy. I hope I can live up to the standards my country is looking for."

Engelbert has checked out some of the opposition, including Ireland's Jedward and said: "They are talented kids and they have a great sense of humour."

Looking forward to after the contest The Hump, as he is known, said: "It would be a delight to share my experience with some of the young ones. I'd love to duet with Adele as she is the hottest mustard in the park."

Despite his age, Engelbert said he is in good health, adding: "I love sport. I play tennis and golf and waterski whenever I go away for a small vacation. That is what has kept me youthful."

He also refused to criticise his ex-manager Gordon Mills, who died in 1986 but is alleged to have stolen millions from the singer during his heyday.

He said: "He started my career, he was a great man. Whatever the case may be, whatever he did I knew nothing about it."
articles.byline: By LEIGH HOLMWOOD, Deputy TV Editor
articles.teaser: THE Eurovision crooner Humperdinck says he still drives girls wild despite age
articles.headline: Engelbert: I'm still sex symbol
articles.subdeck: Surprise choice ... Engelbert Humperdinck

image.caption: New album ... Cheryl Cole

article.caption: Cheryl Cole: I won't return to the X Factor
Cheryl Cole's Expecting
Cheryl Cole's dinner dates with Will.i.am

articles.articlebody:
CHERYL COLE is set to launch her new single on The Voice in a move guaranteed to infuriate former boss Simon Cowell.

Her performance on BBC1's rival to Cowell's Britain's Got Talent was organised by her close pal Will.i.am, who is a judge on the new series.

It will be timed to coincide with the launch of her new album next month.

But sources insist that rumours the former X Factor judge will be a mentor on the BBC1 show are wrong.

A source from The Voice said of the singer's deal yesterday: "It's great news as we've made no secret of the fact we love Cheryl. But obviously Simon will be annoyed as he hates The Voice."

Simon and Cheryl famously fell out after he dumped her from the US X Factor's judging panel last year after just three weeks in the job.

But the pair have recently made up.
articles.teaser: STAR to launch single on rival show in a move that will infuriate her former boss
articles.headline: Cole Voices single in Si snub
articles.subdeck: New album ... Cheryl Cole

image.caption: Record breakers ... One Direction

article.caption: Kim is Harry's Style
One Direction to beat Beatles
One Direction to live the dream

articles.articlebody:
ONE Direction have made history by becoming the first British band to top the US album chart with their debut record.

A sizeable 176,000 copies of Up All Night were sold across the pond in its first week, sending the collection to No1.

The album went one better than its performance in the UK chart, where it peaked at No2 in December.

One Direction  formed on the X Factor in 2010 after failing to impress as solo singers  have hailed their achievement as a "dream come true".

Singer Harry Styles said: "We simply cannot believe that we are No1 in America.

"We want to thank each and every one of our fans in the US who bought our album and we would also like to thank the American public for being so supportive of us."

Niall Horan added: "When we got put together as a group, we couldn't imagine ourselves coming to America, let alone releasing our album here, so for us to be sitting at the top of the US album charts is unbelievable."

One Direction have gone down a storm in the States, with swarms of female fans greeting Harry, Niall, Zayn Malik, Liam Payne and Louis Tomlinson in LA on their first trip to the US.

Since then they've toured with American boyband Big Time Rush, and last week landed their own TV show with kids channel Nickelodeon.

Commenting on their chart-topping album, boss Simon Cowell said: "I couldn't be happier for One Direction, it is an incredible achievement.

"They deserve it. They have the best fans in the world."
articles.teaser: LADS become first UK band to top the US album chart with their debut release
articles.headline: No1 Direction make album history in the States
articles.subdeck: Record breakers ... One Direction

image.caption: Purple plane ... Lianne La Havas is flying over to the US to meet Prince

article.caption: Top Scala gig from Lianne La Havas
Nadine Coyle's comeback 2.0
Prince: Let's go lazy
Prince to Purple reign at Glastonbury

articles.articlebody:
THERE are few musical honours more impressive than getting a nod from Prince.

Lianne La Havas, a singer-songwriter from London, must think she's struck gold after receiving an email from the pop legend inviting her to his studios.

She got the call after she played a live gig last Tuesday which was streamed on her website. And among the 9,000 people watching it on t'interweb was Prince in the US.

She flies to Minneapolis tomorrow to meet the tiny star, who looks oddly like her in these pictures.

A source said: "Prince's email said he was a big fan.

"They are going to record some songs and see what happens."

Hope she's packed some purple threads.
articles.teaser: PURPLE Rain star calls up the singer-songwriter to record tracks with him in the US
articles.headline: Lianne's Prince charming
articles.subdeck: Purple plane ... Lianne La Havas is flying over to the US to meet Prince

image.caption: Huge success ... Adele's album 21 has sold 4,142,000 copies

article.caption: Adele wants to lose weight
Taylor Swift is pop's top earner at £22.5m in a year
'Adele fat? That is ridiculous. She's great, how much she weighs has nothing to do with it'

articles.articlebody:
POP star Adele's chart-topper 21 has overtaken Pink Floyd's landmark 1973 release Dark Side Of The Moon in the UK's best-selling album list.

It is now seventh in the Top Ten after selling 4,142,000 copies.

Another 12,000 and it will overtake No6, Dire Straits' Brothers In Arms.

The 23-year-old Brits and Grammy winner's album's hits include Someone Like You.

An Official Charts Company spokesman said: "It's been an extraordinary 12 months for Adele."

Queen's Greatest Hits is No1 on 5.86 million copies.
articles.teaser: BRITS and Grammy winner's chart-topper overtakes Pink Floyd's Dark Side Of The Moon
articles.headline: Adele's over the Moon
articles.subdeck: Huge success ... Adele's album 21 has sold 4,142,000 copies

image.caption: Disaster movie ... John Carter is set to lose a fortune for Disney

article.caption: Carter the unstoppable pecs machine
Plait's a great look, Helen

articles.articlebody:
DISNEY sci-fi epic John Carter is set to lose £126million this financial quarter  making it the biggest movie flop of all time.

It cost £158million to make the film about a 19th-century US Civil War soldier transported to Mars.

Disney also spent £63million promoting it. But ticket sales  shared with cinemas  only total £116million.

Studio chairman Rich Ross said: "It failed to connect with audiences."

Based on a book by Tarzan creator Edgar Rice Burroughs, the film stars Taylor Kitsch.
articles.teaser: COMPANY spent £158m to make science fiction film and another £63m promoting it
articles.headline: Disney epic John Carter expected to lose £126m
articles.subdeck: Disaster movie ... John Carter is set to lose a fortune for Disney

image.caption: Glitz and glamour ... Jedward and Tara Reid

article.caption: It's Pie time for a Reunion
First look at latest slice of American Pie

articles.articlebody:
JEDWARD had an American Reunion last night  as they hugged Celebrity Big Brother pal Tara Reid at the film's premiere.

The Irish twins joined the actress on the red carpet ahead of a screening of the fourth and final slice of the American Pie franchise.

Sporting their trademark towering barnets, John and Edward Grimes, 20, also donned silver jackets.

They were not the only ones in a party mood at the movie bash.

Actors Jason Biggs (Jim Levenstein) and John Cho playfully sandwiched fellow star Eddie Kaye Thomas (Finch) between them outside Grauman's Chinese Theatre in LA, California.

Alyson Hannigan (Michelle Flaherty-Levenstein) showed off her baby bump as she posed with Eugene Levy  notorious for his role as Jim's dad.

Alyson, 37, in expecting her second child with husband Alexis Denisof.

Meanwhile, Mena Suvari scored top marks in the glamour stakes as she turned heads with her black one-shouldered frock and classy hairdo.

Chris Klein, who plays Oz, posed with screen beauty Katrina Bowden  his boozy, party-loving girlfriend in the film.

Jason, 33, also paired up with Shannon Elizabeth (Nadia)  showing a lot more control in her company than he did in the original 1999 movie.

Seann William Scott, who plays Stifler, was also among those at the opening  looking dapper in a suit.

American Reunion features the hapless gang catching up 13 years after leaving high school at East Great Falls in Michigan.

The original film raised the bar for gross-out comedy, and the final flick promises to be equally shocking.

For example, one scene features Stifler defecating into a bin on the beach.

American Reunion is released in the UK on May 2.
articles.teaser: JOHN and Edward Grimes join actress at American Reunion premiere in LA
articles.headline: Jedward's American Reunion with Tara Reid
articles.subdeck: Glitz and glamour ... Jedward and Tara Reid

image.caption: Cold comfort ... Robert Pattinson faces Kristen Stewart in teaser

video.caption: TAYLOR Lautner and R-Patz star in short glimpse of the final Twilight movie

articles.articlebody:
TWIHARDS have been treated to a tiny bite of the long-awaited Breaking Dawn  Part 2.

A 14-second teaser for the final Twilight movie, released today, has a fleeting glimpse of Kristen Stewart's Bella, who turned vampire at the end of the last movie, running through the woods at her supersonic new speed

Taylor Lautner, as Jacob, faces her and looks surprised she still looks the same.

And, while we never see her face, Robert Pattinson takes her hand and tells her: "We're the same temperature now."

At the end of Breaking Dawn - Part 1 Bella gave birth to the couple's baby, before opening her eyes as a vampire in the final frame.

But the new teaser is keeping Bella's transformation hidden from the bloodthirsty Twilight fans.

More is likely to be revealed in a longer trailer ahead of showings of new flick The Hunger Games, which is released this weekend.

The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn  Part 2 is due for release on November 16 2012, and is set to be the most lucrative of the vampire series.

The previous five movies have a combined box office of £1.6billion.
articles.teaser: WATCH the first footage from vampire movie Breaking Dawn - Part 2 with 14-second teaser
articles.headline: A tiny bite of final Twilight movie
articles.subdeck: Cold comfort ... Robert Pattinson faces Kristen Stewart in teaser

article.caption: Lover offered me £2,000 to abort our Down's boy... but look how full of life he is now!
Susan Boyle: I can take whatever Ricky Gervais says... he's the one with the problem not me
Twit Joey calls rival a 'mong'
My Down's girl almost died, now she's a model

articles.articlebody:
CRYSTAL Pawson cradled her newborn son and feared, at 16, she was too young to be the mum he needed.

Less than 20 minutes later her worries were magnified when doctors revealed her baby had Down's syndrome.

It was a bombshell blow  but 11 years on Crystal believes she is Britain's luckiest mum.

She said: "Cameron is loyal, funny and affectionate and fills my life with love and joy.

"You couldn't hope to meet a more smashing lad. Having Cameron has been the making of me."

The lad is also a brilliant big brother to Luke, ten, Jake, four, Mackenzie, two, and four-month-old Brooklyn.

As the Down's Syndrome Association runs its awareness campaign this week, courageous Crystal, 27, revealed how Cameron has made her a better person.

Around one in every 1,000 babies born in the UK will have Down's and there are 60,000 people in the UK with the condition.

Although the chance of a baby having Down's is higher for older mothers, more babies with Down's are born to younger women  because they have more children.

Crystal fell pregnant at 15 and as the likelihood of having a Down's baby was considered so rare for a mum-to-be of her age, doctors had not even asked if she wanted to be tested.

Like many women, Crystal assumed only older mums had Down's children. She admits when she was first told of her son's diagnosis at Harrogate District Hospital in North Yorkshire, she was horrified and ashamed.

She said: "I was still getting my head round the fact he had Down's when three hours after his birth he was whisked off for a scan.

"When they brought my baby back and told me he had three holes in his heart and would need a major op to fix it, I just fell apart."

The devastated teenager sobbed in her mother's arms.

Back at home in Wetherby, West Yorks, sharing a room with her sister and her new tot made life even harder.

She says: "I couldn't bear to go out, not because I didn't want to show him off but I was so scared he would die.

"He seemed so vulnerable and I was way out of my depth. I sobbed myself to sleep every night and kept thinking 'why me?'"

Cameron's dad, 16-year-old Drew, stood by her  visiting the pair regularly. But Crystal was convinced he would leave her.

She said: "All his mates were out clubbing and he was a 16-year-old lad with a baby with Down's."

At three months old Cameron went in for the op to fix the holes in his heart.

Crystal was warned he would be in hospital for up to three months but after just three weeks he was doing so well he was discharged.

Back at home, while most girls her age were out having fun, 16-year-old Crystal was caring for a very sick baby. Then something amazing happened.

Crystal said: "Cameron just fought and fought and suddenly I realised it was time to stop feeling sorry for myself. I gave myself a massive boot up the backside.

"OK, my son wasn't the perfect baby but he was my son and he deserved a mum who would fight for him all the way."

Drew and Crystal moved in together and the teen parents learnt Makaton, a language programme using signs and symbols, so they could communicate with Cameron as he grew up.

Crystal said: "Being able to sign was a major bonus.

"Cameron and I formed a remarkable bond and suddenly I realised his disability was anything but."

When Crystal fell pregnant with another child when Cameron was just 18 months old, a few friends said she wouldn't be able to cope.

She was offered a nuchal scan to determine the likelihood of Down's, but turned it down.

She said: "I didn't want to know. I coped with Cameron and I knew I'd cope again."

Baby Luke was born healthy, as was Jake two years after.

Crystal said: "The specialists don't know why I had a baby with Down's so young and then it never occurred again. They say it's extremely rare."

When Cameron was seven, Crystal split from his dad, suddenly finding herself a single mum to three boys.

She said: "I'm not saying it was easy but dealing with Cameron gave me the strength to deal with anything.

"Some people close to me thought I would have a breakdown but it was actually Cameron that kept me going.

"He developed this really cheeky, funny personality. He had me in stitches and when I was down he seemed to sense it and would give me a cuddle. He's just so happy I couldn't be sad around him."

Crystal has since found love with 21-year-old shop worker Darren Hooper. The couple have two sons.

She said: "Life's good. Cameron goes to a special needs school which he loves and has really boosted his speech and learning.

"I'll admit that when I first heard my little boy had Down's I reached the depths of despair but now I don't see him as a boy with problems.

"I see him for what he is  an unbelievably loving little boy who loves cuddles and has tons of affection and love to give.

"I know people thought I didn't have the maturity to cope but having Cameron has been the making of me."

And Crystal has high hopes for Cameron's future: "I would love him to move out of home, get a job, marry and go on to have his own family one day and there's no reason why he can't achieve any of those dreams.

"Cameron has ambitions like any boys his age. He loves playing sports and listening to Lady GaGa.

"He tells me he wants to be a footballer one day and I tell him he should aim high and go for it.

"Every child, no matter if they have Down's syndrome, should be given a chance to prove what they can do and lead as ordinary a life as possible."

Sarah offers other parents hope



DOWN'S syndrome actress Sarah Gordy is proof that people with disabilities can lead a full and rewarding life.

The 34-year-old  who plays Lady Pamela on BBC drama Upstairs Downstairs  has starred in many TV shows and plays. And her mum Jane, 63, could not be more proud of her daughter.

But Jane, speaking about discovering her first-born had Down's syndrome, admitted: "Being completely honest, if I was given a test and told my baby had Down's I would have considered a termination.

"I'd have been terrified about not being able to look after her. But that saddens me now.

"When I fell pregnant I wasn't ready to be a mum. In my 20s at the time, I'd never changed a nappy so I felt very unprepared.

"When Sarah was born I couldn't believe how beautiful she was."

Jane didn't have any tests for Down's syndrome because she was under 28 when she fell pregnant. But the paediatrician noticed Sarah had the condition from the moment he saw her.

Jane said: "Calling my husband Jerry aside, he told him that Sarah had the condition. Not only that, but he asked him not to tell me.

"He said it was important for me to form a bond with Sarah first.

"Looking back I don't know how poor Jerry kept it to himself."

It wasn't until four days later that Jane found out.

She said: "I was heartbroken and terrified I would lose my baby. He kept telling me about potential heart problems and operations she'd need.

"But finding out turned me from a girl into a fully-fledged mother."

Luckily, Sarah didn't need any operations. Jane said: "I wish I knew back then what I know now, about how much of an amazing life she'd have."

Jane had another daughter, Catherine, now 32, 16 months after Sarah and admits she felt relief when tests showed she did not have Down's.

Jane said: "I just didn't know if having two children with the condition would be too much.

"I wish parents-to-be were provided with more information about Down's syndrome before they make a decision about termination.

"No one should ever feel pressured either way, but it's such a difficult decision to make without knowing exactly what it will entail."

While everything took longer with Sarah, Jane says she soon realised her daughter had an incredible ability to feel what other people feel.

She said: "If I'm ever stressed or worried and I tell Sarah I'm fine she will say, 'No you're not,' and I have to come clean. We're very close as no emotion goes unnoticed."

And Jane explains that Down's syndrome actors work very differently to those without the condition.

She said: "The interesting thing about Sarah is she doesn't really act. She feels very emotional on set.

"She can't fake emotion, so instead she believes everything about her character.

"Once she was acting as an abused wife and I saw how much the abusive words were hurting her.

"When she came off set I said, 'Sarah  you're a beautiful, successful actress' and she slowly remembered that.

"I like to think that Sarah being successful on TV gives parents who are expecting a Down's syndrome child strength and confidence that their child can lead a really healthy life."

myView



By CAROL BOYS, Chief Executive at Down's Syndrome Association

WE have seen great improvements in the lives of people with Down's syndrome since the association's formation in 1970.

Today, the average life expectancy of people with Down's syndrome is 60 to 65 years, compared to 35 to 40 back in 1970. They are now legally entitled to quality healthcare, good education and jobs and live fulfilling lives.

People with Down's all have a degree of learning difficulty but with the right support they are able to reach many milestones that other people reach.

See downs-syndrome.org.uk or call 0208 614 5100.
articles.byline: By KATE THOMPSON and JENNY FRANCIS
articles.teaser: DIAGNOSIS was a bombshell for Crystal. Now she believes she is Britain's luckiest mum
articles.headline: Mum inspired by Down's son
articles.subdeck: 'Cameron fills my life with love and joy' ... Crystal and her 7-year-old son

article.caption: Sunder the influence...

articles.articlebody:
MEMORY loss, weight gain and depression can all be symptoms of regular heavy nights out drinking.

Many celebrities, including Fearne Cotton, Leona Lewis and Jessie J, are choosing to ditch alcohol.

Prince Harry has stopped pubbing to concentrate on his helicopter training.

Increasing numbers of people are binning the booze and banishing binge drinking from their lives to seek out a healthier lifestyle.

According to NHS figures, at least one in six adults has sworn off alcohol completely, shunning peer pressure in favour of a hangover-free life.

JENNY FRANCIS meets five women who have gone teetotal to find out what life is like without booze.

Linda Obena, 28



THE digital producer from Crystal Palace in south east London went teetotal in October. Sick of her unhealthy lifestyle and size 18 waist, Linda decided to ditch booze for good. She says:

Last autumn I was stuck in a destructive routine of drinking and eating too much.

I'd just broken up with my boyfriend and wanted to move on. I'd read about the LighterLife diet and wanted to give it a go.

Overnight I gave up alcohol and started eating four food packs a day, containing 5-600 calories.

It was a complete shock to the system and the first week was really hard, but I knew it would be worth it.

I used to drink a bottle of wine most nights, on Fridays I'd have work drinks and Saturdays I'd be out drinking with non-work friends.

Sundays were spent recovering. It was relentless. Drinking with clients and colleagues was part of my life and I'd got myself into really bad habits.

It was only after I gave it up I noticed what a big impact it had.

Now after a work night out I'll come into the office whistling and full of energy, while my colleagues are often a step behind me. And I remember all the office gossip!

It's been five months now and I feel stronger, more confident and I have more energy than ever before.

I've gone from 14st 9lb to 12st, from a size 18-16 to a size 14-12  and I know I look as good as I feel.

Laura Coventry, 33



WEDDING photographer Laura, from Glasgow, went teetotal two years ago after bingeing on boozy nights out left her with huge memory blanks. She says:

Like most girls in their twenties and thirties I lived for the weekend.

The prospect of partying and heavy drinking got me through the working week and I'd wish away Monday to Friday.

I drank a lot, not just a couple of glasses of wine, but enough to get seriously drunk. I just loved the euphoria and the buzz that it gave me.

I'd suffer terrible hangovers, I'd regularly be in bed until 5pm with headaches and feeling sick, but I saw it as a price worth paying to let my inhibitions go.

On occasions I'd been out with friends, woken up with a shocking hangover  and realised there were huge blanks in my night out I couldn't remember.

It really scared me and for the first time I questioned why I was doing this to myself. I knew I had to change.

The first two weeks were the hardest, but I managed the first three-month goal I set myself, then extended that to six months.

Now not one drop of booze has passed my lips since February 2010.

Some friends want me to start going out drinking with them again and say that I've proven my point, but I'm determined not to drink again.

I have a fantastic new boyfriend now and I wake up on Mondays smiling, something which never happened before.

I still party but I don't need alcohol to get a buzz. Life feels so much fuller and better.

Lucy Troughton, 31



IT was last October when Lucy went teetotal after realising the damaging effect alcohol was having on her mood. The waitress, from Leamington Spa, Warwickshire, says:

I lived in London between the ages of 19 to 22 and I was out drinking socially most nights. But when I fell pregnant at 23 I didn't drink for the best part of a year.

It's not that I missed it but I still felt very young to be stuck at home, not out partying like I used to.

I was in a band so drinking was almost expected of me.

Most of my friends didn't have kids so there was always someone around to go out drinking with. I soon reverted back to weekend drinking.

I got stuck in a rut of Mondays being a write-off, like I was waiting for the day to finish the moment I woke up.

I wanted to be on form for my daughter Grace, now seven, but I was tired and only realised when it was too late that I was becoming depressed.

In mid-October last year I decided enough was enough and gave up alcohol completely.

It was, and still is, very hard. I didn't go out and became a bit of a recluse, focusing more on my music, gardening and reading.

It's had a huge effect and I really love the mornings now.

I feel so clear-headed. And people often comment on how I'm 'glowing' now.

The idea of a glass of wine with a meal is still a temptation but it does get easier to say "No".

Going teetotal has taught me what I really value. And I'm happier than ever.

Katie Carr, 22



BARMAID Katie from Bridlington, East Yorks, was a beer-swilling, pizza-scoffing ladette.

She went teetotal in July 2010 after binge drinking caused her to have a seizure and a new love interest persuaded her to transform her life. Katie says:

Tequila, sambuca, Jägerbombs  I wasn't fussy. I could get through 20 pints of lager in a night.

In June 2010, I'd been fired from my job as a waitress for consistently turning up to work reeking of alcohol.

Three weeks later, I'd spent £1,200 in my local pub. I put on nine stone in a year on a diet of booze and pizza, weighed 18.5st and was a size 22. I didn't wear make-up or dress girly.

One night in July, I was out with friends when I had a seizure in a nightclub.

I was carried out by a bouncer and taken to hospital by ambulance. The doctor instructed me to stop drinking for six weeks while they ran tests.

While I was sober, I had time to re-evaluate who I was.

Wanting to seize the day, I contacted the bouncer and asked him, "When are you going to take me out?". I was amazed when he said later that week.

Luckily, the CT scans came back clear  I'd just drunk too much. I've not been back on the booze since and have now lost eight stone.

Going teetotal is one of the best things I've ever done.

I've gone from ladette to lady.

Rebecca Spencer, 35



THE charity worker from Southend, Essex, went teetotal seven years ago after a charity trip shocked her into a lifestyle change. She says:

In 2003 I moved to London from Newcastle in search of a new job.

I had a big group of friends and we used to go out every weekend and always drank a lot of vodka. It was just something we did and I didn't see it as a problem.

In 2005 I embarked on a charity trip with Help The Aged to India to photograph how people were rebuilding their lives after the 2004 tsunami.

It was the most eye-opening, inspiring and horrendous experience, all at the same time.

The destruction was overpowering and having an alcoholic drink in that context seemed completely ridiculous.

The experience changed my values and made me completely reassess myself.

Just a few days after being in India I was in Covent Garden surrounded by young professionals knocking back drinks without a thought.

I'd seen people with absolutely nothing and I decided to re-focus my life on the things that counted. Alcohol seemed such a self-destructive extravagance.

As soon as I gave up I realised I'd never even really liked the taste of alcohol  it was just the social side of it I enjoyed.

Nine months after the charity trip I fell pregnant and later had my son.

I felt great and no part of me wanted to drink again.

I've been teetotal for seven years now and feel healthier, more energetic and have much more in my pocket  why go back?
articles.teaser: INCREASING numbers of people are binning alcohol  here five women reveal what it's like to live without booze
articles.headline: Why we're all tee totally happy
articles.subdeck: On the wagon ... (left to right) Linda, Laura, Lucy, Katie and Rebecca
