image.caption: Charge ... Anna Ryder Richardson with husband Colin MacDougall

articles.articlebody:
TV presenter Anna Ryder Richardson is being prosecuted after a toddler and his mum were crushed at her zoo.

Teacher Emma Davies-Hughes, 28, and her son Gruff, three, were visiting the star's wildlife park when a tree branch fell in strong winds.

Gruff suffered serious head injuries and his mum, from Llanelli, Carmarthenshire, was also badly hurt.

He is still having treatment after the incident in Tenby, West Wales, in August 2010.

Ex-Changing Rooms star Anna, 48, was said to have been "devastated" by the accident in the wallaby enclosure.

Pembrokeshire County Council confirmed yesterday that Anna and her husband Colin MacDougall face two charges of breaching the Health and Safety Act.
articles.teaser: PRESENTER Anna Ryder Richardson prosecuted after branch fell at her wildlife park
articles.headline: TV Anna accused over zoo
articles.subdeck: Charge ... Anna Ryder Richardson with husband Colin MacDougall

image.caption: Divorced ... former couple Rula Lenska and Dennis Waterman

article.caption: Dennis: Why Rula got that black eye
Drag act Dennis
Minder's on ball for Five
Hear the new Minder theme
Shane's ban on Minder's Dennis

articles.articlebody:
RULA Lenska has told pal Denise Welch of her relief that Dennis Waterman has finally admitted to hitting her during their 11-year marriage.

Denise, who is a good friend of Rula's, spoke to the actress yesterday just before she was due to appear in her usual slot on Loose Women.

During the ITV1 show Denise revealed: "All that she wants to say is that she is glad that he's eventually admitted it because, several years ago, when the marriage broke up and she first came out and made these allegations, she has since then been perceived as a liar by many quarters."

Denise added: "I was around during the times of their problems so I always knew that she wasn't lying."

The Celebrity Big Brother winner never witnessed any physical violence between the couple herself, but said she was grateful that her friend could now move on and put the shocking events in the past.

Speaking in disbelief, she added: "Why, he (Waterman) has chosen to say it now in such an open way, I'm absolutely astonished, because he must have known what the flack he was going to be but as I say, I'm just glad for Rula that it's been proven that she was telling the truth."

Waterman told Piers Morgan's Life Stories show that he had punched and slapped the actress twice, but was ashamed of his actions.

He said: "The problem with strong intelligent women is that they can argue well. If a woman is a bit of a power freak and determined to put you down, it can happen. Rula certainly wasn't a beaten wife. I lashed out. She was hit and that's different."

He also said that it wasn't hard for a woman to make a man hit her.

Waterman and Rula, both 64, divorced in 1998 amid claims that he was a drunken wife-beater, an allegation he had previously denied.

If you are a victim of domestic abuse and need help visit: www.refuge.org.uk.
articles.teaser: STAR tells pal she is glad that the actor has admitted to hitting her during their marriage
articles.headline: Rula's relief over Dennis admission
articles.subdeck: Divorced ... former couple Rula Lenska and Dennis Waterman

image.caption: Mission ... girls try to sell clothes to London Zoo and shops

article.caption: Our benefits culture is a joke..parents should send their kids out to work at 13  says Lord Sugar
Apprentice wannabe gets a lot of Hype
The Apprentice unveiled

articles.articlebody:
THE Apprentice is back tonight  and one of the teams quickly finds itself in big trouble.

It's boys versus girls and Lord Sugar sets them the challenge of starting a print business  and selling souvenirs to London tourists and day trippers.

The lads target the public with Union Flag T-shirts while the girls print an animal design on to kids' clothes and try to sell them to London Zoo and local shops.

Later tasks in the BBC1 series include designing a household gadget, opening a junk shop and promoting English sparkling wine.

Tonight's opener airs at 9pm.
articles.teaser: IT'S boys vs girls and one group hits trouble as they start a print business in the capital
articles.headline: London lesson for Apprentices
articles.subdeck: Mission ... girls try to sell clothes to London Zoo and shops

image.caption: Call for cuts ... Leahy to Osborne, right

article.caption: £400 tax cut for ordinary workers
Ex-Tesco boss claims there is only room for 'one captain' at chain

articles.articlebody:
EX-TESCO boss Sir Terry Leahy has urged George Osborne to carry on cutting  and let business take the strain.

The supermarket legend yesterday said Government spending was still too high, as he laid out a four-point plan to get Britain motoring.

He claimed public sector budgets had to be tackled  so ministers weren't forced to cut borrowing by piling yet more tax on families and firms.

He also wants action on fuel duty, business rates and the 50p tax in a bid to make Britain THE place to do business.

Sir Terry was speaking to Sun City ahead of a critical Budget from the Chancellor today.

He said: "There's all this talk of cuts but public expenditure is still rising, the Government is running a record deficit and tax is still rising.

"The public sector has been too ambitious in what it has tried to do.

"We have to rebalance the economy. The general principle is that 80 per cent of savings should come from expenditure, 20 per cent from tax."

The veteran insisted the UK economy was "gradually recovering" but warned it was still vulnerable  to both the euro crisis and the price of oil.

And he urged the Chancellor to do his duty  and tackle the spiralling petrol price.

Duty is due to rise by another 3p this August despite record costs at the pump. Sir Terry said: "Duty hikes have to be re-thought at this level of oil price.

"There has to be a regulator. I don't mean in terms of a person, but where the tax take goes down when the oil price goes up.

"It's hitting consumers' expenditure, but also their confidence. If people are putting money in the tank they're not putting it in the trolley."

He said the inflation-busting increase in business rates paid by stores had to be reviewed  they're due to rise another 5.6 per cent in April.

And he said cutting the 50p tax would encourage high earners. He said "The Government needs to set out its stall, show Britain is a competitively taxed economy, where people want to invest, where they want to set up a business."

Sir Terry quit Tesco last year and is now involved in ten separate ventures, including setting up shopping centres in China.



Economy is working ... for us



THE Tories' favourite ad agency claims Britain IS on the mend.

M&C SAATCHI said yesterday that businesses were beginning to spend again  and were trying to gain market share.

Boss David Kershaw told Sun City: "Companies feel a bit better, they don't believe there will be a double dip."

Profits rose 17 per cent to £15.6million on work with clients such as GOOGLE.

UK revenues are expected to climb 11 per cent this year. The Saatchi brothers were the architects of the infamous "Labour Isn't Working" campaign that helped Maggie Thatcher to power in 1979.

And Mr Kershaw said he still believes the Tories are THE party for business.

He said: "The Conservatives are the most business friendly. I wouldn't put the Lib Dems in that camp."

Saatchi also won new campaigns from airline ETIHAD and mobile phone operator O2 last year.



Greggs in WiFi push



BAKER GREGGS will this summer become the biggest provider of next generation WiFi on the high street.

The sandwich-to-sausage roll specialist has struck a deal to launch hotspots in each of its 1,571 shops.

Under a tie-up with WiFi specialist THE CLOUD, the roll-out will begin this month at a pace of 100 stores a week. Internet access will be free for customers.

Greggs has more than six million customers a week and is opening coffee shops.

Cloud chief Vince Russell said: "This deal shows how mainstream this technology has become."



Knickers to KPMG



CREDITORS of high street chain LA SENZA have missed out on £2million in a row over knickers and bras.

Administrators KPMG lost a court tussle over who can sell on a lingerie cargo being sent from Asia when the firm collapsed in January.

Part is STILL on the high seas, but most is now at Tilbury Docks, Essex  and freight specialist UNISERVE won the right to keep it.

Sun City revealed earlier this month that thousands of suppliers to the chain will only get 1p to 5p back for every pound they are owed.



Glencore grain deal



THE world's biggest commodities trader got even bigger yesterday as GLENCORE swallowed grain-handling giant VITERRA.

The mega £3.8billion deal gives Glencore access to key distribution networks in South Australia.

Glencore  which is huge in metals and oils  already owns 270,000 hectares of farmland. It will make £1.6billion back by selling off most of Viterra's Canadian assets to meet regulatory concerns.

The firm refused to say how much grain it would now be handling.



May the Falks be with you



THE British-backed Falklands oil campaign scored a big hit yesterday as a mystery bidder struck a deal to join in.

FALKLAND OIL & GAS said a firm had signed an option to invest in two wells in a deal worth up to £66million.

Argentina, led by Cristina Kirchner, left, has vowed to sue firms scouring for South Atlantic oil. But FO&G shares rose six per cent to 64.50p.



THE BOSS of office rental firm REGUS called on UK plc to get its "mojo" back. Mark Dixon said: "We need to get out there and get on with business."

Annual profits almost doubled to £45.5million.
articles.teaser: Terry butcher! Leahy tells Chancellor to keep on chopping
articles.headline: Terry butcher
articles.subdeck: Call for cuts ... Leahy to Osborne, right

image.caption: Poignant ... coffins at the ceremony

articles.articlebody:
THE fifteen small white coffins of children killed in a tragic coach crash were the haunting focal point of an emotional memorial today.

Belgium's King and the Dutch Crown Prince joined thousands of mourners in Soeverein Arena in Lommel.

They joined together to pay tribute to the 28 victims of the Swiss crash, 22 of them schoolchildren returning from a skiing holiday.

Soldiers brought in the small rose-covered white coffins of the 15 children from Belgian town Lommel's local school who died in the crash, and the larger brown one of their teacher "Meester Raymond".

King Albert II and Queen Paola, both visibly moved by the tragedy, joined 5,000 relatives and friends packed in the community hall.

Singer and TV host Bart Peeters opened the two-and-a-half hour tribute.

He said: "All Belgium is sad, as are our Dutch neighbours."

Mayor of Lommel Peter Vanvelthoven was also at the ceremony.

He said: "The families have asked me to once again express their thanks to the Swiss rescue services.

"As well as to the entire Swiss people who expressed their sympathy."

British boy Sebastian Bowles, 11, was one of the victims of the crash.

He was killed when the coach hit a wall in a motorway tunnel as they were returning home to Belgium.
articles.teaser: THOUSANDS mourn in front of 15 small white coffins at memorial to Belgian school's victims
articles.headline: Tragic toll of coach crash is laid bare
articles.subdeck: Poignant ... coffins at the ceremony

image.caption: Canine nurse ... poorly Zeke is taken with Ralf the Giant Schnauzer

articles.articlebody:
MEET Ralf the giant Schnauzer  a dog who is living up to his reputation of being something of a miracle worker.

The friendly pooch has been doing the rounds at a children's hospital where he met 15-month-old Zeke Harrison.

Zeke  who suffers from a rare genetic disorder that leaves his body unable to break down protein  used his furry eight-year-old friend as a support for his wobbly little legs.

Ralf  who visits the hospital every week  even got two-year-old Claire Couwenberg to walk for the first time in the five days since her surgery to remove a cancerous kidney.

Claire's mum Marie McPhee said when her daughter was handed Ralf's leash, she amazed everyone by standing up to take it.

Marie said: "As soon as she saw him, she stood up, and she very slowly, very wobbly, got on her feet and started to walk, and now you can't stop her.

"I'm lost for words. In a way, I can't believe it."

Toddler Claire took Ralf and led him up and down the corridor at the Royal Children's Hospital in Melbourne, Australia.

Marie added: "It's nice to see her smile today after everything she's been through."

Brenda Kittelty, who organises the dog visits, said: "The dogs bring normality to children in an abnormal, difficult and stressful situation."
articles.teaser: RALF the Giant Schnauzer visits children's hospital and puts a smile on kids' faces
articles.headline: 'Miracle' dog brings joy to sick children
articles.subdeck: Canine nurse ... poorly Zeke is taken with Ralf the Giant Schnauzer

image.caption: Miracle ... Jennifer with cat Demi

articles.articlebody:
A SLEEPING cat survived a 40-minute spin in a tumble dryer  after her unsuspecting owner loaded and used the machine with her inside.

Five-year-old Demi needed oxygen, was put on a drip and given steroids to recover after being exposed to temperatures of 40°C (104°F).

Distraught owner Jennifer Parker, 45, had no idea her beloved cat was napping inside the dryer when she threw in a pile of wet towels.

And she only realised her moggie had been inside when she unloaded the machine.

Mum-of-three Jennifer, from Whitchurch, Shrops, said: "Poor Demi has used up more than one of her lives  it's a miracle she survived.

"I loaded towels into the tumble dryer and put it on.

"It must have been going for 40 minutes when it stopped and I opened the door to see if they needed any more time and heard Demi meowing.

"I looked inside and pulled her out  she was all curled up tight and looked like a ball of fluff.

"I rang our local vet immediately and he told me to bring her in so I ran with her in my arms."

Demi is now expected to make a full recovery after receiving treatment.

Jennifer's 16-year-old daughter Hannah Bolas added: "If it wasn't for the vet she wouldn't be alive  a few more minutes and she wouldn't have survived."

Vet Andy Nelson said: "This is the first time I have seen such a dreadful accident."
articles.teaser: MOGGIE Demi needed oxygen, was put on a drip and given steroids after 40minute cycle
articles.headline: Cat survives 40°C spin in tumble dryer
articles.subdeck: Miracle ... Jennifer with cat Demi

image.caption: We're on the case ... George Osborne on the steps of No11 Downing Street this morning
Tanks for nothing - Chancellor ignores calls for fuel duty cut -Anger at 'stealth-tax' on pension allowances

video.caption: CHANCELLOR George Osborne sticks to planned rise in price of petrol
CHANCELLOR George Osborne delivers statement in Commons
LABOUR leader launches ferocious attack in response to Osborne's speech

articles.articlebody:
MOTORISTS and pensioners were hit today in Chancellor George Osborne's 2012 Budget  but millions of low-paid workers were handed a tax break.

Osborne ignored a YouGov poll in The Sun which showed 77 per cent of people wanted him to slash fuel duty.

Instead he declared: "I do not propose to make any further changes to the fuel duty plans already set out."

The Chancellor was also accused of hitting pensioners hard over tax allowances and there was bad news for smokers, with an extra 37p duty on a packet of cigarettes.

But there was some cheer for lower-waged workers as Osborne raised the personal tax allowance to £9,205.

It means low-paid workers get to keep more of their hard-earned cash and could see millions be better off by £220 a year.

There was also good news for high earners. The Chancellor announced the 50p top rate of tax will drop to 45p from April 2013.

As he announced the cut to the 50 per cent rate, Osborne also closed a number of loopholes and reliefs which he claimed would raise five times more from the wealthy.

'Stealth-tax'

But the Government stood accused of an "outrageous stealth tax" after it emerged that more than four million people who are about to become pensioners will be worse off following changes to simplify the tax system unveiled in the Budget.

At the moment, people over the age of 65 are not taxed on the first £10,500 of their income, but this will be frozen for existing pensioners - and from next April new pensioners will have a tax-free allowance of only £9,205, bringing them into line with the general population.

Around half of pensioners will be affected by the changes, which will raise around £1billion annually for the Government.

Saga director-general Dr Ros Altmann said: "This is an outrageous assault on decent middle-class pensioners.

"This Budget contains an enormous stealth tax for older people. Over the next five years, pensioners with an income of between £10,000 and £24,000 will be paying an extra £3billion in tax while richer pensioners are left unaffected.

"There is nothing in this Budget for savers, there is nothing to improve the annuity market, nothing to appease the damage of quantitative easing and nothing to support ISA changes and shelter older people's money in cash. This Budget is terrible news for pensioners."

Meanwhile, the basic state pension will be increased by £5.30 a week.

Mr Osborne had earlier said the Budget would be good for the UK. "This Budget rewards work. Britain is going to earn its way in the world." he told Parliament.

"There is no other road to recovery.

"This Budget supports working families and helps those looking for work.

"It unashamedly backs business. And it is on the side of aspiration: those who want to do better for themselves and for their families.

"This Budget re-affirms our unwavering commitment to deal with Britain's record debts."

The Government's forecast for UK borrowing for 2011/12 was revised down slightly to £126billion. The UK growth forecast was 2 per cent (down 0.1per cent).

Meanwhile the rich were hit by a 7 per cent stamp duty on properties worth over £2million, or a 15 per cent duty if they are sold via companies in 'corporate envelopes'.



AT-A-GLANCE - see the main points of Budget 2012 below



Mr Osborne cut the top rate of income tax to 45p in the pound for all income over £150,000.

He said that the previous top tax rate had raised less money than expected.



The Chancellor stubbornly refused to cut fuel duty, risking the wrath of Britain's motorists.

He said: "I do not propose to make any further changes to the fuel duty plans already set out."



Child benefit is to be reduced gradually when a member of the household starts earning over £50,000.

Mr Osborne said that if someone earned £60,000 child benefit would be removed completely.



Mr Osborne tried to temper his income tax top rate cut with his stamp duty measure.

He announced a hike from five per cent to seven per cent in stamp duty on homes worth over £2million



The Chancellor said figures showed current year public borrowing would come in at £126billion - a billion less than previously predicted.

He added that Office for Budget Responsibility expected net borrowing to fall to £52 billion by 2016-17.



Smokers were hit hard as Mr Osborne slapped an extra 37p on each pack of cigarettes.

On alcohol he said that there would be no further changes to drink duty rates.



Mr Osborne announced £3billion in allowances for drilling new large and deep fields in a bid to open up oil and gas resources to the West of Shetland.

He also pledged to make administrative savings in the carbon reduction commitment scheme and said combined heat and power plants would be exempt from the carbon price floor.



The Chancellor said he would relax Sunday trading laws during the 2012 Olympics and promised tax credits for video games, animation and TV production in the UK.

He also announced the headline rate of corporation tax to be cut further from next month by one percentage point to 24 per cent.



A massive £100million is to be spent on improving army accommodation.The family welfare grant is to be increased and soldiers serving their country will no longer have to pay council tax when they are deployed.
articles.teaser: GEORGE Osborne makes personal tax allowance £9,205 but ignores fuel duty pleas
articles.headline: TANKS A LOT, GEORGE
articles.subdeck: We're on the case ... George Osborne on the steps of No11 Downing Street this morning

image.caption: Fire crews ... Peckforton Castle

articles.articlebody:
AN arsonist who started a blaze causing £5.4m of damage to the country house where he was having his wedding reception has been jailed for six years.

Max Kay had staged the lavish bash to show off to friends despite the failure of his business, a court heard.

He had rowed with staff over money and was caught on CCTV going in and out of the drawing room where the fire started, Chester Crown Court was told.

It left part of Peckforton Castle blackened and ruined but the dad-of-four gave no reaction when he was sent down.

The court heard that he was under "enormous financial pressure", had a big ego and wanted to impress friends and family with a swanky wedding.

His property business had failed in the economic crash.

It was said the 37-year-old resented being chased by the owners for £15,000 outstanding on the bill and took "revenge" while "massively" drunk after they threatened to cancel the occasion with three days to go, the court heard.

Fire broke out in a wing of the venue near Taporley, Cheshire, around 5am on June 19 last year.

It forced the evacuation of 117 people, including 13 children.

Property developer Kay, of Hunts Cross, Liverpool, pleaded guilty in December to arson that was reckless as to whether life was endangered.

Passing sentence, Judge Roger Dutton said: "It was a miracle that nobody was either seriously hurt or killed by your actions.

"There is a long background to this - principally surrounding, it would appear, your ego.

"Having been made bankrupt and very recently discharged from that bankruptcy, you embarked upon a wedding that would involve paying a figure of approximately £25,000 for a ceremony you could nowhere near afford.

"It was all to maintain a bravado with friends and family and to make it appear you could afford such largesse to friends and family and those you wanted to impress.

"In the end, you sought, and achieved, revenge against the proprietors of Peckforton Castle."
articles.teaser: MAX Kay rowed with staff over payment for bash he could not afford, court heard
articles.headline: Wedding arsonist jailed for six years
articles.subdeck: Fire crews ... Peckforton Castle

image.caption: Playing in the bark, er, park ... Tommy

video.caption: GOLDEN retriever Tommy is happiest when going on the slide at local park

articles.articlebody:
A CUTE dog has become famous after his owner filmed him sliding down a HELTER SKELTER.

Owner Henry Kellie filmed playful Tommie on the slide at a park near his home.

The six-year-old Golden Retriever is the latest doggy viral  with more than 103,000 YouTube users having already seen his antics.

Henry, 45, said he could not believe how popular the video had become.

He said: "It started off with a few hundred hits but it turned to thousands.

"I am astonished by the number of hits it has now received  it has even been copied.

"Tommy just loves sliding down the helter skelter.

"As soon as he gets to the bottom he goes right back to the top."

Henry, a luxury boat builder from Lubenham, Leics, said Tommy's love for the slide came about by accident while they were out walking.

He said: "I was in the play park on the green and wanted to get a better view of the countryside and climbed up.

"It is about 20ft high and when I turned around, Tommy had followed me up.

"I tried walking him back down the spiral staircase but that was impossible.

"So I decided to slide down slowly with him.

"When we got to the bottom I started to walk away but he ran up the staircase and slid down again.

"He has been doing the same every day since."

Henry decided to film Tommy in action after being persuaded by friends who had watched him.

Dawn Moore, who runs the Coach and Horses pub across the road from the play park, said: "Henry brings Tom into the pub and the dog is a real charmer and so friendly with everyone.

"He loves chasing around and performing for treats.

"It is obvious that he loves sliding down the helter skelter, too.

"Henry has difficulty getting him off the slide sometimes so they can carry on a walk."
articles.teaser: GOLDEN retriever Tommy loves to slide
articles.headline: Helter skelter hound spirals to internet fame
articles.subdeck: Playing in the bark, er, park ... Tommy

image.caption: Arrest ... stunning Simone Farrow

articles.articlebody:
A FORMER Penthouse babe accused of being a DRUGS ring boss has been arrested after almost a month on the run.

Blonde beauty Simone Farrow, 37, was wanted for fleeing £100,000 bail by cops investigating a Hollywood trafficking gang.

The stunning model was extradited to Sydney on Wednesday night after she was nicked at a cheap hotel on the Gold Coast Highway in eastern Australia.

She stands accused of trafficking ice  a nickname for crystal meth  in bags of bath salts from her Tinsel Town high-rise apartment, off Sunset Boulevard.

Farrow, who has posed in a series of skimpy outfits in her modelling days, arrived in Sydney Airport flanked by two cops.

She pleaded her innocence as she got there and claimed she only ran away because "someone was trying to murder" her.

Farrow has now been remanded in custody on charges which include the alleged 2009 drug operation.

She is said to have at least 19 aliases and a long-lost teenage daughter but by skipping bail she had put the £100k surety at risk.

Court documents also show that she had legally changed her surname to Lawson in November.

Police have charged her with importing "ice" into Australia and allege she was the brains behind an "ongoing criminal enterprise" that involved at least seven people.

One member of the alleged syndicate committed suicide in a Hollywood motel the day after being contacted by US authorities.

It is claimed Farrow allegedly developed a method of hiding the drugs inside the bath products.
articles.teaser: BLONDE model Simone Farrow was found by cops after a month on the run
articles.headline: Penthouse babe in 'drugs' bust
articles.subdeck: Arrest ... stunning Simone Farrow

image.caption: Action man ... helicopter pilot William

articles.articlebody:
PRINCE William has flown back to Britain to be reunited with wife Kate after spending six weeks apart on his RAF mission in the Falklands.

The Duke of Cambridge was sent to the South Atlantic outcrop in February for what would be the longest the couple had ever spent away from each other.

But he arrived back this morning on a short period of leave before he returns to RAF Valley.

A St James's Palace spokesman said: "The Duke arrived today.

"He will have a short period of leave like the rest of his crew, before returning to work at RAF Valley."

William's posting to the islands highlighted growing tensions between Britain and Argentina over them.

Prime Minister David Cameron and Argentine President Cristina Kirchner been at odds in the lead-up to the 30th anniversary of the invasion of the Falklands on April 2.

Argentina accused the UK of "militarising" the dispute by reportedly sending a submarine carrying nuclear weapons to the South Atlantic, something that Britain has not confirmed.

But Britain has insisted any movements of troops and warships were purely routine, and claimed Argentina was trying to impose an "economic blockade" on the Falklands.
articles.teaser: DUKE to be reunited with Duchess of Cambridge after six weeks away with RAF
articles.headline: Wills back home with wife Kate
articles.subdeck: Action man ... helicopter pilot William

articles.articlebody:
OUR story of March 13 wrongly stated that Prince Harry has been told never to socialise in public and to give up alcohol until deployment.

We have been asked to point out that Prince Harry is fully committed to his intensive pre-deployment training and he has not been told anything by his chain of command that does not apply to any other pilot.
articles.teaser: OUR story of March 13 wrongly stated that Prince Harry has been told never to socialise in public and to give up alcohol until deployment.
articles.headline: Corrections & clarifications

image.caption: Hot property ... sales have soared but iPad warms up

articles.articlebody:
THE latest iPad can reach "uncomfortable" temperatures of up to 46°C (116°F), a consumer watchdog has warned.

The third version of the tablet has been criticised for getting even hotter than the iPad 2 by customers.

And US group Consumer Reports has said people need to be careful when using the device  released last week  especially when playing games.

Spokesman James McQueen said: "It does run warmer than its predecessor.

"People need to exercise caution. We are not saying it is a dangerous product, but 116 degrees can be a little uncomfortable."

The company claims tests show the new iPad, which has a more powerful processor and Retina display screen, gets slightly warmer than the previous model when carrying out the same tasks.

It also said one rear corner appeared to be a hot spot.

Apple refused to comment but released a statement ahead of the report, saying the new iPad operates "well within our thermal specifications".

Three million of the handhelds have been sold since last Friday, making it the strongest iPad launch yet.

The device is available in Australia, the US, France, Canada, Germany, Japan, Singapore, Switzerland, Britain and Hong Kong. It goes on sale in another two dozen countries this Friday.
articles.teaser: NONPROFIT firm says latest Apple tablet can reach temperatures of 46°C for same tasks
articles.headline: iPad heats up to 46°C
articles.subdeck: Hot property ... sales have soared but iPad warms up

image.caption: Worth her weight ... Naomi Kutin, ten, smashed a world weightlifting record

video.caption:
NAOMI KUTIN, 10, breaks raw squat world record
with 214.9 lbs weight

articles.articlebody:
A TEN-YEAR-OLD girl has smashed a world weightlifting record  by hoisting up more than TWO TIMES her body weight.

Naomi Kutin claimed the astonishing achievement after squatting 15st  the same weight as Mike Tyson in his prime  despite weighing just 6.6st herself.

The 4ft 8in year six pupil has been dubbed "Supergirl" by astonished powerlifters.

And Naomi said: "A lot of my friends and all of my teachers didn't believe me when I said I had broken the world record.

"It was only when I brought in my medal and certificate that they did.

"Everyone thought it was really cool.

"It's great being stronger than everyone I know.

"I'm always beating the boys in sports at school."

And her proud dad Ed, from New Jersey, US, said: "Naomi has always jumped higher and done more push-ups than other kids her age, even the boys.

"But beneath it all she is just a normal, shy ten-year-old with an extraordinary talent.

"She went out there, took her chance and won the right to be a world record holder."

Naomi  who was nine when she broke her first world record  has legions of fans around the world who track her progress on the internet.

Many of them were present to witness the moment she reclaimed the record taken from her by 44-year-old Ana Geitner, at the RAW Unity event held in Texas in January 2012, breaking her second record.

Ed, who works in finance, said: "Naomi was surrounded by burly men who would be deemed heavy weights, but she wasn't fazed.

"She was competing against the world's best but she easily drew the biggest crowd.

"And there was Naomi, an average ten-year-old stood among these towering and bulky guys waiting her turn.

"It was quite a sight.

"As soon as she landed that lift, and everyone knew she had broken the record, a roar of applause and cheering broke out."

Astonishingly, Naomi does not intend on stopping there  she wants to break her own record in a bid to preserve her status as the best powerlifter in her weight division.

Naomi said: "If someone breaks the record then I will definitely try and get it back.

"Even if nobody breaks it I will keep trying to get personal bests."

Her mum Neshama, 48, said: "Naomi proves that if you put your mind to something and focus on your goal, anything is possible.

"Other children may be brilliant singers or dancers, but Naomi just happens to be an excellent powerlifter."
articles.teaser: SCHOOLGIRL lifts a whopping 15st to clinch the world record for the second time
articles.headline: 'Supergirl', ten, breaks record with 15st lift
articles.subdeck: Worth her weight ... Naomi Kutin, ten, smashed a world weightlifting record

image.caption: Heartbroken ... Paul with Isabel

articles.articlebody:
A TRAGIC mum of triplets died in hospital eight days after giving birth.

Isabel Mason, 34, passed away in the Royal Hampshire County Hospital in Winchester after delivering babies Mattias, Lukas and Sarah.

German-born Isabel  known as Izzy - died on March 10 after giving birth to the babies on March 2.

An inquest was opened on March 16 and a possible cause of death given as haemopericardium, which is the rupture of the pericardial sac around the heart caused by a cut in an artery.

Her husband Paul said: "Isabel had delivered healthy triplets - Mattias, Lukas and Sarah - and in the precious week in between had been on top of the world.

"We were both overjoyed to be having an instant family, the triplets were our first and most probably last children.

"We looked forward to sharing and introducing our children to our shared hobbies of family time around the kitchen table, playing guitar, listening to German and French radio, country walks, camping, motorbiking, listening to the rain and watching the world go by.

"Since Isabel's death, I have been overwhelmed with the messages of support and tributes to her and we would like to thank all of our friends and colleagues who have been in touch as these words of comfort and kindness mean so much to our family."

The Winchester couple, who married in 2010, both worked for the Ordnance Survey in Southampton.

A spokeswoman for Hampshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust said: "This is a real tragedy and our thoughts and sincere condolences are with the family who we are supporting at this difficult time.

"Of course, due to patient confidentiality, we are unable to share details relating to a patient's care."
articles.teaser: TRAGIC Isabel Mason lost her life in hospital after delivering her three babies
articles.headline: Triplets mum dies eight days after births
articles.subdeck: Heartbroken ... Paul with Isabel

image.caption: Lift off ... birdman Jarno Smeets

video.caption: DUTCHMAN allegedly flies 100 meters in self-designed 'bird-wings'

articles.articlebody:
THE Sky seems to be the limit for this inventive birdman who claims to have mastered human flight.

Jarno Smeets straps movable wings to his back and takes off after flapping them like a bird.

It appears the engineer soars up into the air, gliding for 100 metres before making a gentle landing after 30 seconds.

After his feat, Jarno said: "This was the best moment in my entire life."

But the video was creating some turbulence online as some viewers doubted its authenticity.
articles.teaser: VIDEO: MECHANICAL engineer Jarno Smeets claims to have mastered human flight
articles.headline: Birdman 'masters' human flight
articles.subdeck: Lift off ... birdman Jarno Smeets

image.caption: Blue or false ... are interviewees telling the truth?

video.caption: US talkshow joker quizzes members of the public on viewing habits

articles.articlebody:
US talkshow joker Jimmy Kimmel took to the streets to ask members of the public "Do you watch porn?"  with comedy results.

The funnyman then froze the video and invited his audience to guess if the person did or did not admit viewing blue movies before listening to their answer.

But the final voxpop surprises everybody. Kimmel's clip has already received almost 500,000 views on YouTube and is his latest web success this year.

Previous stunts have included Kimmel urging parents to film their children's reactions when they tell them they've eaten all their Halloween sweets, which clocked up more than three million hits.
articles.teaser: US talkshow joker Jimmy Kimmel quizzes members of public on X-rated viewing habits
articles.headline: 'Do you watch porn?' - Kimmel quizzes public
articles.subdeck: Blue or false ... are interviewees telling the truth?

image.caption: Accident ... Val d'Isere

articles.articlebody:
A YOUNG Brit working in a ski resort has been killed on the slopes.

The 22-year-old resort representative was skiing with several colleagues on a day off when he fell and collided with a snow-making cannon in Val d'Isere, France.

His firm, Crystal Ski, said: "Crystal Ski regrets to confirm that a member of staff was involved in a fatal ski accident at Val d'Isere at 12pm on Tuesday.

"No one else was involved in the accident. His friends who witnessed the fall immediately alerted pisteurs and a doctor attended the scene, but the young man was declared dead."

The company, a division of travel firm TUI, said it was helping make arrangements for the family to fly out to France.

It has also sent a counsellor to help staff who witnessed the incident.

A spokesman said: "Our thoughts are with the family, friends and colleagues at this very difficult time."

The French authorities and the British Consulate in France have been informed.
articles.teaser: THE 22-year-old worked at ski resort and collided with snow cannon on day off
articles.headline: Brit dead in skiing accident
articles.subdeck: Accident ... Val d'Isere

image.caption: Freed ... Judith Tebbutt

video.caption: JUDITH Tebbutt, abducted from Kenyan resort last September is let go

articles.articlebody:
KIDNAPPED Brit Judith Tebbutt says she is "really happy" to have finally been freed after six months in captivity at the hands of Somali pirates.

She was dramatically released today after being taken hostage in September and is on her way back to Kenya.

She told ITV News: "I'm really happy. It's just nice to be around other people, it's been quietly lonely for seven months."

She was freed after a ransom was paid by her relatives, according to reports.

Judith, from Bishop's Stortford, Herts, was snatched from the country by an armed gang who shot her husband dead.

The social worker, 56, was taken from the remote Kiwayu Safari Village beach resort "kicking and screaming" after husband David, 58, was shot in the chest with an AK47.

A speedboat took her into lawless Somalia where pirates held British yacht couple Paul and Rachel Chandler for 13 months.

The couple's son, Oliver, declined to comment today but a friend of Mr Tebbutt said it sounded like "wonderful news".

Somali pirate Bile Hussein and Mohammed Hussein, an official with the militia Ahlu Sunnah Wal Jama, said Judith, was released by pirates holding her today and was expected to be flown to the Kenyan capital Nairobi.



David was a publishing exec with Faber & Faber and was a member of the Book Trade Charity.

Its chief executive David Hicks knew him for 15 years and said today: "This sounds wonderful, though I'll only really be happy when it's definite that she's safe."

Local MP Richard Harrington, from Watford, told Sky News: "Our thoughts are with Oliver, who must have such feelings today. Under the circumstances, he's done absolutely fantastically.



"To see his parents go on holiday, and saying he'll see them in a couple of weeks' time, in the most routine way that happens to all of us, then to find what happened to his father, and his mother, for so long whereabouts unknown, I'm sure he's got the deepest emotional feelings today, that none of us will ever experience in our lives, but I think he's conducted himself for one so young so extremely well, and I do nothing other than just commend him."

A team of Metropolitan Police officers travelled to Kenya to help authorities investigating the case.
articles.teaser: SOCIAL worker 'is free' after six months in captivity at hands of Somali pirates
articles.headline: Somali pirates 'have released' kidnapped Brit Judith Tebbutt
articles.subdeck: Freed ... Judith Tebbutt

image.caption: Tragic ... Luke Chapman collapsed on pitch

articles.articlebody:
A BOY of 15 has died after collapsing during a rugby match.

Ambulance crews were called after reports Luke Chapman stopped breathing on the pitch.

He was airlifted from Baxter College in Kidderminster, Worcs.

But he passed away shortly after arriving at Birmingham Children's Hospital.

A spokesman for West Midlands Ambulance Service said: "Crews arrived to find a boy who was not breathing and CPR was being carried out.

"Ambulance crews took over resuscitation attempts and advanced life support was carried out at the scene.

"The boy was transferred to Birmingham Children's Hospital by air ambulance for further emergency treatment.

"Unfortunately, despite the best efforts of ambulance crews and hospital staff, nothing could be done to save the boy and he passed away shortly after arriving at hospital."

Luke was a pupil at Haybridge High in Hagley, Worcs. Tony Homer, chair of governors at the school, said in a statement: "We are all terribly shocked and upset by what has happened.

"Our thoughts are with the family and friends at this very sad time. The school will offer all the support we possibly can to those affected."

A spokeswoman for Worcestershire County Council said the school was in a state of shock following the teenager's death on Tuesday.
articles.teaser: A 15-YEAR-OLD schoolboy has died after collapsing during a rugby match
articles.headline: Schoolboy, 15, dies after collapsing at rugby match
articles.subdeck: Tragic ... Luke Chapman collapsed on pitch

image.caption: Troubled ... retailer Game

article.caption: Troubled Game chain nears collapse
Game group in crisis as supplier pulls plug

articles.articlebody:
GAME GROUP is on the brink of collapse  after admitting it was worthless.

Some 6,000 UK jobs are hanging by a thread after the struggling video games chain suspended its shares from trading in the City.

In a statement the board said it was "of the opinion that there is no equity value left in the group".

It came as electricals specialist COMET put a third of its high street stores up for sale.

Comet is owned by OPCAPITA, the private equity fund trying to strike a deal to save Game.

Sources close to Game told The Sun that OpCapita is struggling to find an agreement with Game's banks  led by ROYAL BANK OF SCOTLAND.

Game, drowning under debts of almost £180million, will go bust this weekend unless a deal can be reached. The group has a £21million rent bill to pay on Sunday and it owes £10million in VAT.

One insider said: "We cannot believe the way the banks have handled this. They seem to want us to fail."

Game's collapse is the latest hammer blow to hit the high street. Big name chains such as PEACOCKS, LA SENZA and BLACKS LEISURE have all collapsed since Christmas.

Game runs more than 600 stores in Britain but has been clobbered by fierce competition for best-sellers from the supermarkets and the rise of internet gaming.

MASS EFFECT 3 hit the top of the video game charts earlier this month  despite maker ELECTRONIC ARTS refusing to supply Game with the release.
articles.teaser: SHARES in retailer Game Group have been suspended on the London Stock Exchange 'pending clarification of the company's financial position'
articles.headline: 'Worthless' Game Group on brink of collapse
articles.subdeck: Troubled ... retailer Game

article.caption: Gun fiend filmed school bloodbath for sick kicks

video.caption: PROSECUTOR claims suspected gunman has said he will surrender

articles.articlebody:
ARMED cops are preparing to storm an apartment where the suspected Toulouse serial killer is holed up.

Police have been involved in a siege lasting 13 hours with the alleged shooter - named as 24-year-old Mohammed Mera.

Officers could now go in despite earlier reports in France saying Mera had been arrested.

Cedric Delage, regional secretary for a police union, said the suspect has promised to turn himself into police shortly. Delage says if that doesn't happen, police will force their way in to arrest him.

It has been reported that he has since said he will give himself up later this evening.

He refused to surrender this morning and later threw a handgun out of the window and declared he would surrender this afternoon but the situation has reached a stalemate.

The siege in the Croix-Daurade district of Toulouse came two days after a single gunman massacred Rabbi Jonathan Sandler, 30, his sons aged six and three, and a girl of eight at a Jewish school in the city.

He was filmed on CCTV riding a stolen scooter and switching weapons when one jammed.

He also killed three soldiers in two separate attacks in the region last week. The same weapon, a Colt 45, and the same bike were used in all three.

French Interior Minister Claude Gueant said the suspect "wants to take revenge for Palestinian children" killed in the Middle East, and is angry at the French military for its operations abroad.

Gueant said he is thought to be armed with a Kalashnikov assault rifle, a Mini-Uzi 9mm machine pistol and other handguns, but had thrown a .45 pistol he used to murder seven people in recent weeks from the window.

The minister said the gunman had stopped talking to police. He added that French authorities had been monitoring him for years.

Two officers sustained minor knee and shoulder injuries during the shootout and the man's brother has been arrested.

The suspect's mother has also been taken to the scene to negotiate with him. But she refused, saying she "had little influence on him".

Mr Gueant also revealed the gunman said "he belongs to al-Qaeda" and was known to the authorities after spending time in Afghanistan and Pakistan. Cops swooped on the property last night close to the scene of the first attack.

He added: "When they arrived, the wanted individual shot at the door."

As the raid got underway overnight, the bodies of the victims of the latest shooting arrived in Israel for burial today.

The victims were paratroopers Cpl Abel Chennouf, Sgt Imad Ibn Ziaten and Pte Mohamed Legouad.

Then on Monday Rabbi Jonathan Sandler, 30, his sons Gavriel and Aryeh, six and three, and the principal of the Jewish school's daughter Miriam Monsonego, eight, were shot dead.
articles.teaser: FRENCH police exchange gunfire in stand-off with man suspected of killing three people in Toulouse
articles.headline: French cops 'prepare to storm siege flat'
